title: Marketing Manager (contract)
description:
**Marketing Manager (Contract)**

 *Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.*

 **Summary:**


We're seeking a Contract Recruitment Marketing Manager focused primarily on the tactical aspects of recruitment marketing campaigns - from development and deployment to management and measurement. This role demands a clear focus on execution, an analytical approach to decision-making, and a strong ability to work within existing frameworks to optimize recruitment efforts.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Execute and manage recruitment marketing campaigns (organic and paid), ensuring they are delivered on time and meet predefined objectives.
* Develop project briefs to inform agency and creative executions.
* Utilize existing employer branding assets and resources efficiently, integrating creative solutions to enhance campaign effectiveness.
* Assist in localization of hiring campaigns and EVP work, ensuring relevance in various geographical and niche markets across the Americas.
* Process incoming requests from Microsoft stakeholders, leverage their inputs to create a project plan and strategic approach to marketing requests.

 **Requirements:**

* Extraordinary attention to detail.
* Experience storytelling with brand narratives & working on multiple campaigns at once.
* Ability to manage projects and prioritize next steps. Understands timelines and can weigh in to inform schedule.
* Creative problem-solving skills, with an aptitude for optimizing existing resources and tools.
* Problem solving skills with ability to adapt to shifting priorities.
* Experience in cross-functional collaboration, able to work effectively with teams from various departments including brand, communications, recruiting, finance, operations, and procurement.
* Must be able to work independently on tasks and provide strategic leadership in execution.
* Prior experience in localizing content and employer branding messages for recruitment campaigns preferred.

 **Additional Details:**

* Location: Remote
* Duration: 3 months
* Pay Range: $32 - 36 per hour

  



  

*AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: Content Writer
description:
Newsletter Pro is dedicated to helping small businesses grow by building genuine client relationships. We create custom print newsletters and other digital and physical products emphasizing connection, personality, and brand engagement. Everything we do focuses on reflecting the values and voice of the incredible entrepreneurs we work with. Our clients are located nationwide (and beyond) and work in various industries.

Our home office is in Boise, Idaho, with many of our employees working remotely from over a dozen states across the US. Our diverse team handles every step of the newsletter process, from writing and editing to design and production.

***This is a full-time remote position.***

***A cover letter is required.***

Benefits

* Competitive compensation
* Medical, dental, vision, and FSA options for employees and dependents
* Short-term disability - We pay 100% for employee
* Life Insurance - We pay 100% for employee
* Voluntary Life Insurance Options
* PTO - 10 accrued days per year
* Six paid holidays per year

***NEWSLETTER PRO IS AN EQUAL-OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER*** 

**Required**

* Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, or another relevant field
* At least three years of verifiable professional content writing/editing experience
* Minimum of 1 year ghostwriting experience

**About the role**

Our writers are content wizards who create custom articles for our clients and internal marketing pieces for our newsletter, website, and social media accounts. They also work with our clients to develop a vision for their newsletters, find ways to add value, and create a product that people will love to read.

* **This is NOT a freelance position.**
* Monthly phone calls with clients to discuss topics and develop a distinct voice for each campaign
* Conduct research on a wide range of topics ranging from dentistry and physical therapy to history and pop culture
* Write up to 100 articles per month (average of 5-6 per day, 300-500 words each)
* Schedule and complete 2-3 Interviews each day
* Create content designed to be engaging, informative, fun, and personal
* Work in close collaboration with designers, project managers, and editors to ensure high-quality editions are mailed on time every month
* Tackle special projects and internal initiatives as needed

**The successful candidate is prepared to provide writing samples and complete a mock interview to advance in the interview process.**

**About you**

* Love to write and have experience creating compelling content
* Positive and collaborative work ethic
* Thrive in an environment where fast pace and quality go hand in hand
* Confident on the phone and love building meaningful relationships with clients
* Interested in shaping content and helping our clients give their readers the best
* Understand content marketing and the process of brand-building
* Don’t mind tackling an article at a moment’s notice
* Enjoy doing research and love learning new things
* Work well in a team-based environment and value collaboration

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Signage Content Delivery Manager
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
The Digital Content Services Team is looking for a Digital Content Delivery Manager. The Content Services team is responsible for providing leadership of the Content Management and the Content Creative team. The Content Management team will QC of content asset files, scheduling. They also troubleshoot content issues in partnership with AV and IT team. This team is also responsible to troubleshoot content issues that could arise and need escalation to the creative engineering team. The team's manager is responsible for planning, scoping, scheduling, reporting and effectively managing the deliverables for a team of highly creative technical members, serving as the daily contact for internal and external resources. This person will represent the capabilities of the team and work with Sales to properly scope deliverables.
  
What will you be doing?
  
* The Digital Content Delivery Manager will refine the documentation and processes that empower the Content. As part of a larger technology team, you will collaborate with the AV and IT Engineering support teams to troubleshoot any escalations along the way. The Manager will continue to ensure that all client relationships are maintained correctly and lead the effort in guiding all clients to successful strategies.
* Implement and Complete Client run books for content delivery.
* Team utilization, time tracking and workforce planning ensuring the quality of Content Services for a variety of clients and projects. The manager is expected to track workload, time management, hour reporting, issues to resolution, understand SLA and contract requirements to be executed and delivered against with team members.
* Responsible for the fulfillment of the client SOW requirements, as it relates to the talents and skills needed to deliver. Responsible for delivery of services with On Site personnel and partners when required. The ability to onboard new employees and service providers is required.
* Help grow Diversified’s Service offerings and cost model by providing expertise in transforming client requirements into actionable operational trackable deliverables that feed.
* Develop ways for onsite team track metrics of the production team in scheduling, forecasting, and reporting on capacity planning for both people and lab equipment requirements Identify needs and support creation of team structure as Media Services expands (supervisors, managers, team leads).
* Assist in pricing the delivery of the service solutions for RFPs, standard proposals, and quotes. Ability to write SOWs for sub labor and backfill. Ability to manage contractor, SOW’s, project management when required determine internal vs. external asks of the team.
* Provide insight, coaching and professional development to team to enhance knowledge and technical skills. Employee development and mentoring of professional goals for individual contributors.
* Provide overall management direction for projects and be accountable for project results.


**Physical Working Environment/Location:**  

* On Prem to start –Diversified office -Kenilworth NJ, Hybrid
* Role requires the ability to move 50-75lbs of equipment as needed.
* Travel/Mobility necessary.


What do we require from you?
  
  

**Education/Certifications:**  

* 5-7+ years in a Digital Signage, Creative Digital Content, Productions, or associated, technology managerial role or similar is required.
* Industry certifications such as ITIL, CTS, A+, MS-Certs are an assets.


**Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience and Skills:**  

* Knowledge of Digital Signage Content Management Systems and Digital Experiential Content creation, CMS applications, programing, creative content processes
* Graphic Design, Broadcast, Video Production, Concept through Creation Production Process is considered mandatory.
* 3-5 years leadership of technical service personnel + P&L responsibility
* Experience with recruitment, employee management, and general HR concepts preferred.
* People leadership skills, technical capability, professionalism, self-motivation, self-discipline, focus and attention to detail.
* Experience managing a technical creative team.
* Working knowledge of SOWs, Contracts, Managed Services and Deliverables is a major asset.
* Experience working within a ticketing system and managing service tickets/incidents (ConnectWise/Service Now).
* Ability to organize and schedule work & personnel effectively.
* Excellent communication, planning, time-management, and follow-through skills


To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: Content Creator
description:
**About Us:**

**At Nateega, we are a dynamic and results-oriented company providing a wide range of services including marketing, graphic design, social media management, content creation, and consulting. Our team of professionals brings together diverse cultures from America, Europe, and the Middle East, uniting under a shared mission to help businesses of all sizes achieve true success in their industries. With a personalized approach, we strive to understand the unique challenges faced by our clients, tailoring initiatives that drive their growth and accelerate their accomplishments. The name "Nateega," meaning "result" in Arabic, perfectly represents our goal-oriented nature.**

**Are you skilled in content creation and comfortable in front of the camera? We are seeking individuals adept at on-camera presence or with user-generated content (UGC) experience to feature in diverse client videos spanning medical, sports, and fitness sectors. While we welcome freelancers, commitment is preferred, though this role can complement existing employment as a side hustle.**

**Responsibilities:**

* **Collaborate with the Nateega team to create and execute content for client videos, ensuring alignment with their objectives.**
* **Produce engaging content across various platforms to showcase client offerings.**
* **Cultivate and engage with audiences authentically, fostering dedicated followings.**
* **Maintain an authentic online presence reflecting clients' brand ethos.**

**Qualifications:**

* **Demonstrated experience in content creation, with proficiency on platforms like Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, etc.**
* **In-depth knowledge of social media trends and best practices.**
* **Strong communication and storytelling abilities.**
* **Proficiency in creating visually appealing content.**
* **Eagerness to stay abreast of industry trends and adapt accordingly.**
* **Collaborative mindset for seamless integration within the Nateega team and with clients.**

**Additional Information:**

* **Opportunity to collaborate with a diverse clientele.**
* **Compensation and benefits to be discussed during interviews.**
* **Flexible work arrangements will be available for suitable candidates.**

**If you possess a flair for content creation and thrive in the social media landscape, we invite you to apply. Join our team at Nateega and contribute to driving remarkable results for our clients while advancing your own influencer journey.**

**www.nateega.com**

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Contract

Pay: $37.65 - $43.34 per hour

Work Location: Remote

title: Program Manager (L5) - Developer Education
description:
Los Gatos, California
Core Engineering
Location: Remote Friendly  

About the team
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  

The Developer Enablement team sits at the intersection of Engineering and Learning & Development, and ensures that the technical learning strategy is well integrated with the overall employee learning journey at Netflix. Our mission is to help all Netflix engineers, scientists, and solution developers be as informed and productive as possible by ensuring they have access to curated knowledge, education, and support resources, when and where they need them.  

Team initiatives include new hire engineering onboarding, continuing education, JIT/on-demand training, overall knowledge strategy for technical training execution, and delivery of Engineering wide programs to build community and drive a culture of learning.  

About the role  

General Program Manager 5 with breadth and depth of experience in Developer Enablement  

We are looking for an innovative, proactive General Program Manager who is passionate about technical training, content creation, discovering and applying data insights, and has a strong opinion on documentation strategies. The Developer Education (DevEd) team’s mission is to transform the engineering landscape of onboarding and continuing education programs into a more interactive, impactful, and engaging experience. Your team is responsible for all engineering onboarding and continuing education training, planning, delivery, and development, including communication campaigns, metric tracking and reporting, defining and aligning training personas, and cross-team partnership training implementation. We’re looking for a self-starter who is excited to give and receive feedback, can ruthlessly prioritize, and is passionate about technology, learning, and can think outside of the box to help us scale. You should be someone who loves discovering new data and metrics, is quick to soak in information and make a smart decision based on data, and brings focused energy to the team and engineering community.  

Will require travel to the Netflix offices for onboarding and quarterly on-sites.**What you will do...**
-----------------------

* Manage and prioritize requests for new and updated technical training and documentation.
* Guide content creation alongside stakeholders, continually scanning for necessary updates, learning gaps, or outdated material.
* Manage Paved Road, Manuals, and other documentation platforms, partnering with GTM to create documentation for new tooling.
* Responsible for data reporting, signaling, and trending, using data from ESO, Manuals, and Search, to make informed decisions about content creation and documentation.
* Partner with internal and external program managers, instructional designers, technical writers, and facilitators for developer education program execution.
* Foster a culture of learning that promotes inclusion and diversity in our teams, interactions, and learning models.
**Your experience must include or demonstrate…**
------------------------------------------------

* Discovering and applying data insights, including experience measuring leading and lagging learning metrics and using those insights to guide strategy and operations.
* Creating and editing engaging documentation, with a strong opinion on documentation strategy including sustainability, maintenance, and archiving.
* Managing and prioritizing a large number and variety of requests for new and updated technical training, including guiding content creation alongside stakeholders.
* Designing and implementing diverse learning formats using blended instructional methods.
* Navigating diverse stakeholder groups, forming and sustaining successful partnerships by influencing up, down, and across.
* Creating and maintaining a learning culture that amplifies the organization’s potential.
**Other attributes that will excite us…**
-----------------------------------------

* A sense of humility, adaptability to change, and a bias towards action.
* Strong technical understanding and skill set with an ability to communicate with engineers and create and understand technically complex training.
* Good understanding of the education space for engineers and data scientists, including learning styles and approaches.
* A track record of consistently and successfully delivering technical education and community-building training and events.

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Productivity Engineering, feel free to listen to this podcast.  

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $210,000-$315,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: Content Marketer
description:
**About us**

CoachArt matches kids impacted by chronic illness who want to *learn* an art or athletic activity with a volunteer coach who can *teach* them that activity. That helps kids shed the label of "sick kid" at scale.

**Overview**

CoachArt, a leading nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of children with chronic illnesses through arts and athletics, is seeking a highly creative and skilled Content Marketer. This pivotal role will lead our content creation efforts across CoachArt Inspire, our digital platform dedicated to empowering, educating, and inspiring our community. The ideal candidate will be a masterful storyteller capable of using a range of modern tools to craft and distribute compelling content that resonates with our audience. This position is perfect for someone passionate about making a difference through powerful storytelling and innovative content creation.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Content Strategy & Execution: Develop and implement a comprehensive content strategy that includes video, blog, social media, and livestream content to support CoachArt's mission and goals.
* Project Management: Serve as the project manager for all content on CoachArt Inspire, ensuring timely production and publication of high-quality content.
* Interviewing & Communicating with Families and Volunteers: Sourcing stories by talking to the participants in our programs.
* Video Production & Editing: Create and edit engaging video content that tells the stories of CoachArt's impact on children and their families.
* AI Content Creation: Utilize AI content tools for prompt engineering to generate innovative and compelling content pieces. Continuously explore and integrate new tools and technologies to enhance content creation and distribution.
* Managing promotion and cross-promotion: Working with individuals and partners featured in the content to amplify the awareness of the content.
* Content Planning & Reporting: Plan content calendars, oversee content production workflows, and report on content performance metrics to inform strategy adjustments and improvements.
* Collaboration & Leadership: Work closely with the marketing team, program staff, and volunteers to gather content ideas and stories. Lead and inspire a team dedicated to creating impactful content.

**Required Skills and Qualifications**

* Experience in Content Marketing: Proven track record of creating and managing a wide variety of content types, including video, written, social media, and livestream content.
* Video Editing Proficiency: Strong skills in video editing software and storytelling through visual media.
* Expertise in AI Content Tools: Experience with prompt engineering for AI content creation tools, demonstrating the ability to leverage AI for enhancing content quality and efficiency.
* Strategic Content Planning: Ability to develop and execute a content strategy that aligns with organizational goals, including planning, execution, and performance analysis.
* Analytical Skills: Proficiency in content reporting and analytics tools to evaluate content performance and make data-driven decisions.
* Exceptional Storytelling: Outstanding ability to tell compelling stories that engage and inspire a diverse audience.
* Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members, volunteers, and the broader CoachArt community.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,186.00 - $74,732.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Demand Generation Content Manager
description:
Overview:
**Working at Atlassian**


Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

**Compensation**


At Atlassian, we strive to design equitable, explainable, and competitive compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Base pay within the range is ultimately determined by a candidate's skills, expertise, or experience. In the United States, we have three geographic pay zones. For this role, our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:


Zone A: $150,700 - $200,900


Zone B: $135,600 - $180,800


Zone C: $125,100 - $166,700


This role may also be eligible for benefits, bonuses, commissions, and equity.


Please visit go.atlassian.com/payzones for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.


Atlassian is looking for a passionate **Sr. Demand Generation Content Manager** to support our sales and campaign teams across the Atlassian portfolio of products. Our products help teams plan and track, build, and collaborate across IT Service Management, Agile & DevOps, and Work Management.


As the Sr. Demand Generation Content Manager, you will develop and execute full-funnel, multi-channel content and campaign assets focused on driving customer acquisition, activation, and expansion. In this role, you’ll partner with teams across Customer Lifecycle Marketing, Product Marketing, Events, and Sales to craft and repurpose assets, and experiment with different channels and formats to fuel campaigns and programs throughout the audience journey.


This person must be adept at working across multiple marketing crafts and audiences, with a knack for connecting the dots across an integrated content and campaign strategy.


Responsibilities:
**What you’ll do:**

* Partner with Product Marketing to map content and narratives to fuel campaigns
* Partner with Customer Lifecycle Marketing to advise on new channels, map assets to channels, and advise on best practices for assets in each channel
* Partner with SEO to ensure SEO strategy is aligned across PMM and CLM
* Partner with Events Marketing on content strategy and execution for owned events and field events
* Contribute to asset creation and repurposing across written and digital formats
* Where relevant, contribute to sales enablement (social selling, sales outreach sequences, account-based marketing programs)
* Manage processes and tools for asset creation, shelf life extension, and sunsetting as needed, create frameworks and workflows to help us scale content across the organization
* Key point-of-contact for creative agencies, manage budget for asset creation, ensure deliverables meet internal standards
* Report on performance and make data-driven recommendations about content priorities, investments, and experiments


Qualifications:
**On your first day, we'll expect you have:**

* 7+ years of experience in content marketing and demand generation
* Strategy and execution experience in content marketing, including social media, writing/editing, long-form and short-form content
* Strategy and execution experience in demand generation, including content for lead magnets, campaign funnels and lead scoring, personalized nurture journeys, and sales enablement
* Experience in SaaS or other technical industries, ability to pick up complex topics
* Bonus: experience incorporating AI into workflows


#LI-Remote

**Our perks & benefits**


Atlassian offers a variety of perks and benefits to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health coverage, paid volunteer days, wellness resources, and so much more. Visit **go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits**to learn more.

**About Atlassian**


At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.


We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.


To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit **go.atlassian.com/crh****.**

title: SEO and Website Manager
description:
Advirtis is a Nationwide White Label digital advertising and SEO agency. Advirtis partners with Marketing agencies across the US and Canada, to deliver on client projects under the partner brands.

**Why Did We Build Advirtis?**

That is a very simple answer….TO SERVE

* To serve our FAMILIES well by providing for our wives and children so that they may be taken care of first and foremost. If we cannot take care of our families, then how can we take care of anyone else’s needs.
* To serve our TEAM well by building and sustaining a business that allows members of Advirtis to provide for their families as well as the people that depend on them. We want to make sure each and every Advirtis team member has a consistent place of work they can depend on.
* To serve our COMMUNITIES well by listening to their needs, creating innovative solutions, and implementing exciting campaigns that stand out in a crowd. We want every client to make sure their hand is raised when a potential customer searches for what they have to offer the community at large.

**​Primary Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement effective optimization strategies to improve client's search engine rankings
* Conduct thorough research on SEO keywords for websites and marketing materials
* Set measurable goals to track and demonstrate marketing improvements
* Monitor daily performance metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of SEO strategies
* Collaborate closely with other marketing professionals to align goals and strategies
* Work within the marketing department to manage overall SEO strategy
* Update website content and links to maximize optimization and search engine rankings
* Prepare and present comprehensive SEO performance reports using relevant metrics and KPIs
* Conduct virtual meetings with agencies and clients to present SEO findings and metrics
* Plan, create, and manage PPC campaigns across various channels
* Conduct keyword research and effectively manage bidding by adding PPC keywords and negative keywords
* Optimize bidding at different levels, including keyword, placement, device, geographic, demographic, and others
* Perform daily account management of PPC campaigns, ensuring adherence to ad spend budgets and maintaining important metrics
* Write compelling copy to enhance click-through rates on ads and conversion rates on landing pages
* Generate performance reports analyzing campaign trends, goals, opportunities, and key performance indicators
* Stay up to date with search engine and PPC industry trends

**Secondary Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Create and optimize landing pages using platforms like Unbounce, WordPress, or others
* Manage additional accounts as required
* Possess basic knowledge and certifications in advertising platforms such as Google, LinkedIn, Meta, etc.
* Assist in implementing conversion tracking using tools like Google Analytics, Tag Manager, Search Console, Call Rail, etc.
* Support the account management team with SEO/PPC audits and sales-related activities

**Qualifications:**

* Proven success in developing and executing SEO/PPC campaigns, including the ability to build compelling case studies
* Strong understanding of search engine algorithms and ranking methods
* Experience with SEO industry programs, such as Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMRush, etc.
* Proficiency in keyword research and data mining tools
* Ability to conduct competitive analysis within the industry
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective correspondence
* Comfortable analyzing and interpreting data on a daily basis
* Familiarity with WordPress or other content management systems
* Additional experience in marketing aspects like copywriting and content creation is a plus
* Proficient in project management tools such as Teamwork, G-Suite, Trello, HubSpot, etc.
* Strong proficiency in Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and LinkedIn Ads
* Track record of success in developing and executing PPC campaigns
* Experience with Google Analytics and expertise in setting up conversion tracking
* Competence across all channels of social media
* Ability to conduct PPC audits for clients
* Strong attention to detail and exceptional interpersonal and presentation skills
* Creative thinking, analytical, research, and problem-solving abilities
* Additional experience in marketing aspects such as content creation and web design is a plus

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $4,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Where are you located?

Experience:

* SEO: 2 years (Required)
* WordPress: 2 years (Required)
* SEMrush: 2 years (Required)
* client management: 2 years (Required)
* Marketing Agency: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* Google Analytics Certification (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Pulso Video Producer & Content Manager (Full Time, Remote)
description:
Remote
Work Type: Full Time


**Role:** **Video Producer & Content Manager** (Full Time, Remote)

**Organization:** Pulso**Reports to**: Founder & Executive Director, Liz Alarcón**Direct Reports**: TBD**Location**: Full-time, 100% remote position (from home or co-working space) with occasional travel once every 2-3 months**COVID-19:** We take Covid-19 safety very seriously. Employees must follow our Covid safety protocols and be fully vaccinated and boostered. Accommodations are provided to the extent required by law. For employees based in the state of Florida and Texas, the COVID-19 vaccine is encouraged but not required due to Florida and Texas laws. **About Pulso**
Pulso is a Latino-led social enterprise dedicated to raising up and keeping the pulse on nuestra gente. We build deep digital relationships with Latinx folks through their phones in order to transform civic engagement and build political power.


Pulso attracts and engages Latinos through our innovative Latino history and news service, via Facebook Messenger, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Twitter and The Pulso Podcast. With this daily relationship and by telling the stories that have shaped our community, Pulso connects U.S.-based Latinos/as/x with our history and encourages subscribers to take action on critical issues, register to vote, and to cast their votes on Election Day.


To see the digitally-based service we’re building, search for “Project Pulso” in the Facebook Messenger app. You can also learn more about our work at https://projectpulso.org/.


Pulso is a project of Accelerate Change (AC), a nonprofit media lab dedicated to catalyzing new scalable and sustainable digital media models for citizen engagement. See “The Secret of Scale” for more on AC’s model for scalable citizen organizing read and see “The Promise of Lean Experimentation” or AC’s approach to experimentation using Lean Startup methodologies and other business strategies, both from the *Stanford Social Innovation Review.*

**Summary**


The role of Video Producer & Content Manager is crucial as we aim to scale the reach of The Pulso Podcast and our history and culture video content across social media.

 **R****esponsibilities**
Here’s what you can expect to do in this role:

* Manage video content created for distribution across Pulso platforms (primarily Instagram, TikTok, and Youtube), both by Pulso staff and influencers, ensuring alignment with content that our audiences find engaging and shareable.
* Oversee Pulso’s video production process including crafting stories and graphics, reviewing scripts, editing video, and iterating videos for all platforms.
* Manage the pre-production and post-production of the The Pulso Podcast long-form videos.
* Collaborate with the team on lean video experimentation, supporting the development of high quality content that is optimized for distribution, defining video best practices, and serving as the subject matter experiment for video platforms.
* Analyze and report key metrics and experimentation data for platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Youtube and others), identifying actionable, data-driven insights.
* Support team with experiments related to influencer engagement and implementing other cross-network digital tools.
* Support with management of Pulso’s content calendar, managing sharing videos across all platforms.
* Support copywriting and publishing of daily posts when needed.
* Collaborate with the rest of the content team to brainstorm new content experiments and ideas, actively participating in brainstorming sessions.
* Actively collaborate with partner organizations in experiment-sharing calls and Slack channels, sharing best practices, troubleshooting, socializing technical platform updates, gathering partner learnings and evaluating how those learnings could improve Pulso’s products and services.
* Manage future staff and/or temporary contractors as needed.
* Embody and communicate the organization's progressive values and commitment to elevating the US Latino community.
* Keep up to date with current events, relevant social issues, and evolving technical platform updates.

**Experience**

* 4+ years of experience, with demonstrated experience editing photo and/or video for digital platforms
* Experience with assigning and editing staff and freelance creators
* Demonstrated experience implementing strategy and running digital media campaigns on several of these platforms: TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, Facebook Messenger, Facebook and Instagram Ads, and others. You also keep up with the most recent features and updates across these platforms.
* At least one year of leadership experience, with management of direct reports a plus.
* Strong visual storytelling skills.

**Benefits**

* $67,000-$77,000 salary range, with exact salary depending on experience and new staff rarely starting at the top of the range.
* Flexibility for work and life: Unlike a lot of places, we actually believe that people should only work 40 hours each week, except for occasional sprints that require more time. We also trust everyone to make a schedule that works for them, as long as they’re able to join all the necessary meetings and complete all assignments and tasks. Respect for the freedom to work more one day and less the next, with an understanding of the need to work during off hours and on weekends to make up for time spent on balancing job responsibilities and personal life during the week, including parenting and taking care of mental and physical health.
* Health care after 3 months, with individual premiums fully covered and cost-share for dependents. Vision and dental plans are available at-cost to the individual.
* 15 paid vacation days, 6 paid holidays, 3 paid floating holidays each year and 7.5 paid sick days each year
* Professional development funds, with renewal of funds each fiscal year.
* Need-based educational loans assistance after 3 months.
* Cell phone and internet reimbursement (or co-working reimbursement): We acknowledge that working from home requires using your own internet and phone for work purposes so we offer a set reimbursement amount for cell phone and internet usage. If working home isn’t for you, we also have the option for folks to rent a co-working space and get reimbursed for their monthly costs.
* 401(k) plan after one year, with 100% employer match on the first 3% and 50% employer match on the next 2%.
* Annual office closure during the last week in December

 *Pulso is incubated by Accelerate Change; Accelerate Change is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that people of color, people from working class backgrounds, women, and LGBTQIA+ people must be centered in the work we do. Hence, we strongly encourage applications from people with these identities, or who are members of other marginalized communities.*

title: Content Program Manager
description:
At Apartment List, we're on a mission to find every renter a home they love at the value they deserve. Finding the right place to live is one of the most important, time-consuming and expensive decisions that all of us make. Getting it right matters. We've helped millions of families find a home they love, and we're just getting started.


This role will report into our GTM Enablement organization. The Content Strategy role is central to aligning our business goals with the needs of our target audience, enhancing our go-to-market strategy through the management of Highspot, our resource library. This position fosters collaboration across departments like Marketing, Sales, and Product to ensure content efforts are cohesive with overall business objectives. Additionally, it involves working with GTM leadership to develop programs addressing sales performance and skill gaps. A key responsibility includes analyzing content metrics to refine our strategies, alongside developing and implementing distribution plans to extend content reach. This role also oversees the creation of engaging, high-quality content in partnership with cross-functional teams, ensuring it aligns with our brand and meets audience needs. If you're driven by the challenge of elevating content strategy and execution, this opportunity awaits to make a meaningful difference.


**Here's what you'll do as part of the team:**



Internal Content Strategy:


* Develop and implement a comprehensive content strategy aligned with business objectives.
* Work closely with the Content and Training Manager, Marketing, Sales, Product, and other teams to align content initiatives with overall business goals.
* Assist in collaborating with GTM leadership to identify training and resource needs which include developing tailored programs to address skill gaps and improve overall sales performance.


Content Development:


* Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure accuracy and depth of content.
* Manage the end-to-end content creation process, from ideation to publication.
* Ensure content is aligned with brand guidelines, messaging, and tone.


**Here are the skills and experience you'll need to be successful:**


* You have excellent communication skills to work with sales, marketing, and product teams to gather information and feedback on content needs.
* You have the ability to collaborate with stakeholders to ensure content meets the needs of the sales team and aligns with company objectives.
* You are proficient in using content management systems (CMS) such as Highspot, Rise360, Articulate, Sana, etc. to update and manage sales content across various platforms.
* You have the ability to organize and categorize content for easy access by the sales team.
* You have experience working at a startup.
* You have strong writing skills to create compelling sales content, including product descriptions, sales guides, and SOPs.
* You have strong editing and proofreading skills to ensure content accuracy, clarity, and coherence.

**Here's what's in it for you (full-time employees only; does not apply to contract roles):**


* Competitive Compensation: Including annual salary, pre-IPO stock options, and other financial compensation (if applicable)
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage: 100% of premiums covered for you AND all of your dependents
* Unlimited Flexible Time Off: Unlimited FTO in addition to 12 company holidays per year, quarterly "recharge" days, and a week-long holiday break
* Home Office Reimbursement: To cover home office furniture and supplies, monthly home internet, and monthly cell phone (if applicable)
* Health & Wellness Reimbursement: To cover monthly gym membership or other qualifying expenses
* Parental Support: Generous parental and family leave, fertility benefits, and employer-sponsored stipends towards family forming services
* 401k Plan: To support you in your individual retirement goals
* Team Events: Frequent team-building events, fun team off-sites, and bi-annual company meetups
* Commitment to DEI: To prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within our workplace and to stay true to our values and mission
* Mentorship and Training: To get you onboard quickly, learn new professional skills, and invest in your career development
* Impact and Visibility: To expose you to and provide the opportunity to work on highly strategic initiatives that will transform the business
* Encouragement and Empowerment: To explore and adopt new technologies and drive meaningful decisions and outcomes


At Apartment List we believe that everyone deserves a home they love AND a career they love. We strive to build a diverse team that is a reflection of the people we serve; this is made possible through our commitment to fostering a culture of diversity, inclusion, equity, and connectedness.



As a proud equal opportunity employer, we celebrate the collection of individual differences, life experiences, ideas, perspectives, knowledge, and talent. We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status.



#LI-Remote

title: Content & Special Projects Manager
description:
At a Glance:

Earn weekly pay with BDS! The Content & Special Projects Manager will be responsible for managing a team to create, edit and deliver training content across multiple platforms for Motorola’s Field team. This role will also be responsible for overseeing special projects on the Motorola program including, but not limited to Tap a Tech, Events, MotoVan, and ASR.  

Take a look at our video showcasing Why You Belong at BDS! Apply today and embark on a new career journey!
Overview:
**WHAT WE OFFER*** $50,000 - $60,000 base salary with bonus potential
* Weekly pay
* Health and wellness benefits plans
* Flexible vacation and holiday policies
* Paid parental leave
* 401(k) with employer matching
* Auto allowance
* Referral bonus
* Tax savings with flexible spending accounts for parking, transit, dependents, and healthcare costs
* Opportunity to work with a growing company that actively rewards and promotes its employees

 **WHAT YOU'LL DO*** Lead and manage a team to provide copy, images, videos, and communications for all training content and content requests
* Maintain editorial calendar and project manage individual tasks from assignment to delivery
* Oversee all aspects of Tap a Tech program including dashboarding, rep management, scheduling, supplies and training
* Launch and oversee ASR program, including, but not limited to training team, and providing weekly updates to client
* Manage event process and work with event team to ensure all events are staffed, MotoAgents have supplies, and recaps are sent after all events
* Work creatively and proactively to create demos for events, props and event/van themes
* Be a forward thinker to anticipate possible issues that may arise and have solutions/back up plans in place for the team
* Oversee MotoVan project including, but not limited to keeping van wrapped with current devices, hiring van drivers, sending over weekly budget updates, and ordering supplies
* Other duties as assigned by management

 **WHAT YOU'LL BRING****Experience and Education:*** Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, another related field or equivalent work experience is preferred
* 1-2 years of previous experience in copy writing, creative promotional writing, proof reading, and video editing
* 3-4 years of management experience
* Consumer Electronics experience; wireless and/or digital imaging product knowledge is preferred
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office suite, and Adobe Suite

**Skills and Attributes:*** Excellent problem solving, strategic and critical thinking skills
* Excellent time management
* Excellent organizational and interpersonal and communication skills
* Excellent presentation and written communication skills
* Ability to work independently and drive projects to completion with minimum supervision
* Ability to engage cross-functional teams in a collaborative manner

**Physical Requirements**
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to:* Regularly talk, sit, stand, walk and bend over, repetitive use of hands/arms, repetitive use of legs and grasp
* Continuous hand/eye coordination and fine manipulation
* Occasionally carry and lift office supplies up to 10 lbs.


Important Information:

We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with Criminal Histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

  

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

  

BDS Marketing, LLC. (“BDS”) is an equal opportunity employer in every aspect of employment, including but not limited to; selection, training, development and promotion of the most qualified candidates and employees without regard to their race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by state or local law. BDS is committed to equal employment opportunity in all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment that may not be covered in this statement. BDS is an at-will employer.

  

BDS is an award-winning sales and marketing solutions provider. Built on 35 years of experience, we offer a custom mix of Digital, Experiential, Advocacy, and Display solutions that create unforgettable experiences everywhere. BDS is headquartered in Irvine, California with regional offices in Chicago, Illinois; New York City, New York; and Columbus, Ohio. Whether you’re looking for a great work environment, flexible roles, work-life balance, the chance to learn new skills, or opportunities for growth, we have a variety of positions that work for you. Power your career by joining our award-winning team today! BDS Marketing, LLC. is a division of BDS Solutions Group, LLC. For more information, visit www.BDSmktg.com.

title: Brand Organic Content Manager
description:
**About the Company:**

The Ridge crafts products made to last a lifetime through with simple, functional designs ready for anything and everything. Our materials are chosen with care and a thoughtful connection to the insights of our growing community - setting our North star as we strive to improve everyday. Together we can do more with less.

Ridge started with The Ridge Wallet as a Kickstarter project in 2013 and is now in the hands and pockets of over 3 million people worldwide! We currently operate around the globe selling in the US, Canada, the UK, EU, and Australia on Shopify and through other channels such as Amazon and Wholesalers. We have also expanded and continue to expand our product catalog to include KeyCases, Bolt Action Pens, Knives, Rings, Watches and we have plenty more in the works!

We are looking for people interested in positions with tremendous growth potential, but which come with high expectations of work rate and quality of work. We are a fully remote company and utilize that to find the best talent around the world to join our team. Since we are a remote-first company, we always do our best to be as accommodating to a healthy work/life balance.

**About the role:** Reporting to the VP of Brand, the Organic Content Manager for Ridge will be a key driver in the activation of the overall organic content strategy for Ridge owned channels. The role being content lead collaborates closely with the Creative and Marketing teams to translate our high-level strategy to conceptualizations in social, and then into actionable content plans. This role will play a pivotal role in amplifying Ridge's brand presence, fostering community engagement, and ensuring our content reflects the unique values and qualities of Ridge products.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Content First Strategy**

* Generate innovative and captivating content concepts that resonate with the target audience and align with the brand's messaging.
* Lead the end-to-end production of these concepts, from ideation to implementation and evaluation.
* Collaborate with internal and external teams to bring content ideas to fruition, leveraging cross-functional expertise and resources.
* Create a content roadmap covering various channels across social - IG, TT, Youtube platforms.
* Partner with Customer Experience teams to monitor social trends and gather feedback for continuous improvement.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to integrate content into digital marketing campaigns - with a primary focus on owned channels such as email and/or sms.

**Qualifications**

* Possess a minimum of 3 years of experience in content strategy or a related field.
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field. Having a strong background in production and graphic design is a plus.
* Proven success in developing and executing content and brand visual strategies within the consumer goods industry.
* Organic content focused with a strong passion for the Social channels.
* Strong leadership skills with a track record of collaborating across high-performing teams.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with an understanding of the Ridge brand voice.
* Possess comprehensive knowledge of consumer goods trends and competitor landscapes, with the ability to translate insights into actionable strategies.
* Proficient in project management methodologies, with the ability to effectively plan, organize, and execute content initiatives within established timelines and budgets.

Ridge is an equal-opportunity employer committed to fostering diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 per year

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Content Manager
description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!  

The Marketing Content Manager will play a foundational role in supporting the company's content, product and demand generation departments. The Marketing Content Manager specializes in writing for marketing communications and helps drive the company’s marketing strategy by working alongside functional leads to create compelling, high-quality content across all stages of the buyer’s journey. This person is an exceptional writer that can successfully manage the full cycle of content—long-form and short-form—from collaborative ideation to execution and create content designed to enhance Restaurant365’s position as a trusted thought leader while turning prospects into customers.
### **How you'll add value:**

+ Produce thought leadership and SEO optimized content for blogs, guides, short form email, advertising and web by collaborating with internal teams to develop and execute content strategies that advance business objectives.
+ Partner cross functionally with R365 subject matter experts to produce thought leadership and product-focused webinar content, slide decks, and content to promote the webinar externally.
+ Collaborate with companywide departments to source and produce high-impact customer and partner case studies that support sales initiatives.
+ Handle one-off requests from different departments to help aid with employee engagement and recruitment campaigns.
+ Partner with marketing operations, digital marketing, and product marketing to optimize content across both the digital and buyer’s journeys.
+ Measure content KPIs with respect to month over month growth and high-level performance for leadership.
+ Other duties as assigned.

### **What you'll need to be successful in this role:**

+ 4-6 years of content writing experience, preferably in a SaaS environment.
+ Bachelor’s degree or higher in a related area of study.
+ The ability to write at a high level across a variety of formats.
+ Attention to detail while creating new content, interviewing subject matter experts and aligning content deadlines with existing marketing programs.
+ Ability to work cross functionally with sales, product and customer success teams
+ Experience using data to analyze content consumption patterns and adjust content strategy accordingly.
+ Experience using WordPress, Marketo, SEO Optimization Tools, and Salesforce.
+ Expert understanding of how-to craft and evolve B2B narratives.

### **R365 Team Member Benefits & Compensation**

+ This position has a salary range of $80K-$115K. The above range represents the expected salary range for this position. The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
+ Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee
+ 401k + matching
+ Equity Option Grant
+ Unlimited PTO + Company holidays
+ Wellness initiatives
  

#BI-Remote
$80,000 - $115,000 a year
R365 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage all forward-thinkers who embrace change and possess a positive attitude to apply.

title: Junior TikTok Creator Manager
description:
About Us:  
Join our industry-leading agency as we continue to set the standard in the dynamic world of social commerce. Specialising in creating engaging, innovative content for short-form video platforms, we’re at the forefront of tapping into the power of social media to drive success. With a focus on creativity, collaboration, and cutting-edge strategies, we offer an unparalleled environment for growth and professional development.Role Overview:  
We’re on the hunt for a Junior TikTok Creator Manager with a passion for social media and a knack for nurturing creative talent. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is eager to work with some of the most talented short-form video creators in the industry.Key Responsibilities:

* Collaborate with TikTok creators to develop and execute engaging content strategies.
* Monitor trends on TikTok to inform content creation and strategy adjustments.
* Provide ongoing support and guidance to creators, ensuring the highest quality of content.
* Analyse performance data to enhance content effectiveness and creator growth.
* Facilitate creative workshops and training sessions for creators.

Benefits:

* Fully Remote Work: Enjoy the flexibility of working from anywhere within the US.
* Unlimited Holiday: We believe in work-life balance and offer unlimited holiday to support it.
* Fast Career Progression: As a leading agency, we provide rapid career advancement opportunities for our team members.
* Competitive Compensation: Earn between $15-$17 USD per hour, commensurate with your experience and skills.

Requirements:

* Minimum 1 year of experience working with short-form video creators, specifically on platforms like TikTok.
* Strong understanding of social media trends and TikTok content creation.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

How to Apply:  
If you’re ready to take your career to the next level with a pioneering agency, we’d love to hear from you. Apply directly on Indeed by 1st March 2024 to become part of our dynamic team!

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $15.00 - $17.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* No weekends

Work Location: Remote

title: Manager, Client Solutions
description:
Influential is a key leader in the Influencer Marketing space (and the LARGEST influencer marketing company in the world, by revenue). Trusted by over 60% of the Fortune 500, we connect our clients with a network of over 3 Million social media influencers.



We are looking for team members who are thrilled by the idea of playing an active role in shaping how companies engage with customers through TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, & more. Our team is built of people from across the country who have already moved the needle in social media, influencer marketing, and various sectors of technology. Ready to join us?!


**What we offer:**


* Remote company - work from home!
* Competitive compensation
* Unlimited PTO with inclusive holiday benefits
* 100% company paid medical, dental & vision insurance for employees
* Equity options for all employees
* Fully vested 401(k) matching
* Stipends for phone & wifi, health & wellness, and more!
* An awesome collaborative work culture, a diverse team, and more

Influential, is looking for an experienced **Manager** to join our **Client Solutions** team. The ideal candidate will learn how we execute campaigns, working closely with our Client and Campaign Management teams to ensure scope, timelines, and processes are met. We're looking for team members who are eager to learn and ready to dive headfirst into all things Influential. The ideal candidate can handle multiple competing tasks on a daily basis and has a passion for **beauty and professional haircare products.**

  


**In general, on a typical day you will:**


* Manage the workflow and completion of tasks within our project management platform
* Support campaign execution teams in all aspects of planning and reporting
* Coordinate closely with Campaign Management on creator communication to ensure scope, timelines, and protocols are being met
* Act as liaison between talent and Influential to ensure deliverables and payments are organized and timely
* Perform content moderation to ensure brand safety is met for every participating influencer across all social campaigns
* Communicate effectively (written & verbal) with key stakeholders including Account Management, Performance Media, Strategy & Analytics, and Operations to track deliverables and ensure client needs are being met
* Become an expert in our proprietary tech platform, organizing talent and campaign information as necessary

  


**Being a Manager, Client Solutions requires:**


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of work experience in digital, online, PR or advertising environment
* **Experience working with beauty brands, with an emphasis in haircare**
* Interest in managing and coordinating projects in a fast-paced environment
* Superior written and verbal communication skills with even stronger attention to detail
* Comfortable working autonomously in a fully remote environment where details often change
* Knowledgeable and/or interested in all major social platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest)
* Proficiency in Google Apps and MS Office, and other general technology platforms
* You keep up with the latest trends and innovations within the world of social media


**Bonus points if:**


* Experience at a marketing-tech or media start-up
* You're passionate about social media and/or influencer marketing


**Salary Range:**



$80,000 - $105,000

**About Influential**



Influential is an AI-powered technology and is the largest influencer marketing company in the world, by revenue. Leveraging a network of over 3 Million social media influencers, Influential's platform powers seamless talent discovery, comprehensive brand safety, content creation, media, and measurement. Through strategic partnerships with first and third-party data providers, Influential enables exclusive targeting and measurement solutions, including both online and offline attribution, such as sales lift, TV tune-in lift, foot traffic, and eComm sales. Influential works with Fortune 500 brands, including McDonald's, NBA, General Mills, Ford, and every major studio. With offices in Los Angeles, NYC, and Las Vegas, Influential is a developer partner of IBM Watson, a strategic partner of WME and Oracle, and a Facebook and Instagram Marketing Partner. (www.influential.co)



Influential is an equal opportunity employer.



Privacy Notice for California Job Applicants

title: SharePoint Content Manager
description:
**Job Title:** SharePoint Content Manager

**Location:** Fully Remote

**Salary:** DOE + full benefits

**Clearance:** Active Public Trust (or ability to obtain)

**Job Summary**


We are seeking a skilled SharePoint Content Manager to join our dynamic team. As a SharePoint Content Manager, you will be responsible for the development, organization, and maintenance of our SharePoint platform to ensure it meets the needs of our organization. You will collaborate with various departments to understand their requirements and implement solutions to optimize content management and collaboration processes.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Develop and maintain SharePoint sites, libraries, lists, and other content structures.
* Customize SharePoint sites and workflows to meet the specific needs of different departments.
* Create and manage user permissions and access controls for SharePoint sites and content.
* Train users on SharePoint functionality and best practices for content management.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and implement solutions to improve content management processes.
* Monitor SharePoint performance and troubleshoot issues as they arise.
* Stay up to date on SharePoint updates, features, and best practices to ensure the platform is utilized effectively.
* Conduct regular audits of SharePoint content and permissions to ensure compliance with organizational policies and procedures.
* Provide technical support to users experiencing issues with SharePoint functionality.

**Required Skill/Qualifications**

* Proven experience managing SharePoint environments in a corporate setting.
* Strong understanding of SharePoint architecture, features, and capabilities.
* Proficiency in customizing SharePoint sites, lists, libraries, and workflows.
* Experience with SharePoint permissions management and access controls.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality solutions.
* SharePoint certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified: SharePoint Administrator) is a plus.

**Education**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Equivalent practical experience will also be considered.

title: Manager, Content, Digital Banking
description:
**COMPANY DESCRIPTION:** Forbright is a nationwide full-service bank and lender helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable and low-carbon economy. Headquartered in Chevy Chase, Maryland, Forbright is committed to accelerating the transition to a sustainable economy by financing visionary leader in clean energy, healthcare, technology, financial services, real estate, and other industries with extraordinary service.

**COMPANY CULTURE:** We are a dynamic, high energy, fun, and fast-paced organization that has an exciting growth trajectory, meaningful mission, and embedded responsible environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices into our daily interactions. We offer our team members a culture of collaboration, inclusion, flexibility, recognition, and giving back. We look to hire individuals that are passionate about our mission, and who are motivated, customer and results-oriented, innovative, adaptable, and thoughtful.

**COMPANY MISSION:** We are a mission-driven institution with an uncommon commitment to decarbonization and sustainability. As the need to build a more sustainable, low-carbon economic system grows increasingly urgent, we are dedicating capital to financing the companies, investors, and innovators driving that change. We are reimagining how a bank should operate in a changing world.

**JOB SUMMARY:** The Manager, Content, Digital Banking is responsible for the digital content creation, publication, and optimization processes of all digital content for Forbright Bank’s Digital Banking group. This position will report to the AVP of Content Strategy, Digital Banking, and work closely with the Brand and Enterprise Marketing team. This position will play a leading role in shaping and managing the digital content landscape for banking products, ensuring content meets business objectives and expresses our brand and value proposition centered on sustainability. The Manager, Content, Digital Banking will be responsible for executing and helping to refine existing digital content strategies, editing website articles, emails, newsletters, and social media posts, managing content approvals, and authoring webpages in WordPress. This position also will track digital content performance across various digital platforms as they relate to Digital Banking, with a primary focus on our organization’s website, landing pages, monthly newsletter, social media posts, and banking-app content.  

  

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:*** Work with cross-functional teams and agency partners to aggregate needs and translate business objectives into website content, landing pages, in-app content, and e-mail and social assets
* Lead review, editing, and feedback process of digital content, partnering with Enterprise stakeholders to develop engaging and high-quality content for the website
* Author all digital banking pages and updates in WordPress, and assist in managing the website's taxonomy, content tagging data model, and page templates
* Manage an editorial calendar to plan and schedule content releases, campaigns, and promotions for digital properties, collaborating with our agency partners and social media, technology, and email marketing teams
* Develop and implement strategies for content distribution across various digital platforms, including social media and email marketing
* Collaborate with the AVP, Content Strategy, Digital Banking and Enterprise stakeholders to plan and execute site architecture and user experience enhancements for forbrightbank.com content
* Monitor the performance of Digital Banking content using analytics tools
* Track key metrics and identify data insights to help refine Digital Banking content strategy and to optimize future deliverables
* Regularly conduct content audits, ensuring accuracy, relevance, performance, and compliance with industry best practices, SEO, legal and compliance, and brand guidelines
* Assist in the creation, optimization, and monitoring of landing pages in partnership with Paid Media team
* Identify areas for improvement and optimization for existing assets and help develop new processes and best practice guidelines

**QUALIFICATIONS:*** 4-7 years experience, agency experience preferred
* Proven experience in website and digital content management, preferably in a similar role
* Familiarity with digital and social media analytics tools and ability to interpret data to inform strategies
* Knowledge of SEO principles
* Experience with WordPress, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager
* Creative mindset with the ability to think outside the box and deliver innovative content ideas
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
* Proactive problem-solving abilities and a results-oriented mindset
* Self-motivated, highly organized, and detail-oriented
* Ability to manage and prioritize several simultaneous projects with sense of urgency
* Portfolio demonstrating experience in content strategy or creation and management is required

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:** The requirements described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable employees to perform the essential functions. Work is conducted primarily in an office; however, some positions may be conducted remotely via technology. While performing duties of this job, the employee may be regularly required for prolonged periods of time to:* Sit or stand at a desk
* Walk, stoop down, crouch, kneel or bend over
* Use hands and fingers
* Utilize a computer monitor with visual acuity
* Operate technology and other office machinery such as printers, fax machines, scanners, etc
* Communicate clearly both verbally and in writing with others

*The pay range for this position is below. The specific rate will depend on the successful candidate’s qualifications and prior experience. $92,700 (entry level qualifications) to $113,300 (highly experienced).* **ADDITIONAL DUTIES:** For Forbright Bank to remain efficient and nimble as a growing organization, team members are expected to exhibit a high level of flexibility regarding any duties that may be situationally assigned outside of this job description.


**PERKS/BENEFITS:**


* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans
* 4 weeks PTO
* 401k + company match
* Metro SmartTrip benefits ($50/mo)
* Remote or hybrid work schedules for most positions
* Bonuses for purchasing solar panels, electric vehicles, biking to work, etc.
* Paid subscriptions to Veterans Compost, Imperfect Foods, and more!
* Best Workplaces for Commuters 2023 & 2024 winner
* The Washington Post Top Workplaces 2023 winner
* American Banker Best Banks to Work For 2023 winner


*It is the policy of Forbright Bank to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals and to administer all aspects and conditions of pre-employment and employment without regard to protected characteristics.*
