title: Associate Brand Manager, Agency (sister brand to Curology)
description:
Curology is creating the next generation of skincare through customized treatment plans and formulas with powerful prescription ingredients for acne and anti-aging. We believe great skin shouldn’t be a luxury, but a fact of life.  

  

Most brand management roles at traditional brands are slow and stagnant. You inherit a great history, but end up focused on protecting past success rather than blazing paths for future growth. And most startup brand management roles, well, they don’t exist. The C-suite runs the business, and brand management becomes brand marketing, without a strong connection to business results.  

At Curology, we’re changing that. We are looking to hire an Associate Brand Manager to help propel Agency to our next level of growth. Your job will be to support the Brand Lead of Agency to launch 360 marketing campaigns, bring Agency’s brand marketing to the next level and supercharge our evergreen marketing across organic social, influencer, PR and more.
### **What you'll do:**

+ Analyze the business and develop an in-depth understanding of key drivers
+ Own performance tracking for new initiatives, deriving insights from the data which will enable brand leaders as they set the direction for brand growth
+ Size and scope innovation (product + marketing) opportunities through the development of robust forecasts and business models to prove out ROI and size of prize
+ Partner with the Brand Lead of Agency, to identify net new future growth levers to inflect the business [ex. New audience segments]
+ Get hands on with execution, partnering with integrated marketing, creative, product/packaging, engineering, consumer insights, medical, legal - to bring plans to life
+ Lead go-to-market launches of new products, developing and closely monitoring detailed timelines and managing cross functional stakeholders, looking for opportunities to optimize the tools and processes to brief in teamsLead development of world-class briefs that effectively communicated the “what”, “how” and “why” for brand campaigns and product launches
+ Lead our brand’s expansion into new distribution channels, developing competitive pricing strategies, best in class content to support the launch and managing marketing budget

### **About you:**

+ **You are analytical but able to go beyond the data:** you are able to derive key insights from a variety of data points and sources and put them into context to get to the “so what”
+ **You love a challenge and are self-driven:** you thrive under pressure and can very quickly become a subject matter expert on any subject through self-drive; you can take on projects and manage them end-to-end, seeking help and guidance as needed
+ **Exceptional communicator:** you can clearly communicate complex ideas through different mediums; you are able to build relationships quickly
+ **Humble and a great team player:** you are constantly trying to learn from others and you have a flexible approach that enables strong collaboration with cross-functional partners; you have a can-do attitude and will roll up your sleeves to do what is needed for the team
+ **2-4 Years in CPG Brand Management:** You have worked in Brand Management at a traditional CPG company, with experience in DTC
+ **Motivated by curiosity,** whether solving a problem, pursuing a new experience, or seeking creative inspiration
+ **Results-driven, solution-oriented, flexible,** self-driving, and must have the ability to change course quickly

### **You'll love working at Curology because:**

+ Competitive salary and equity packages
+ Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; flexible spending account; 401k; mental health & wellness programs
+ $75 WFH stipend (remote employees)
+ Home office setup stipend (remote employees)
+ Minimum Time Off policy (unlimited PTO, with at least 3 weeks off) for exempt employees
+ 11 company observed holidays
+ Additional holidays: Curology days off (1 per quarter), 1 annual floating holiday (employee’s choice), and Gratitude Week (employees take the full week of Thanksgiving off; business critical teams observe different days)
+ Paid parental leave
+ Employee donation matching program
+ Company-sponsored events
+ Free subscription to Curology or Agency

$81,000 - $120,000 a year
Our mission is simple: to make personalized skincare accessible and convenient for all. Awarded #3 for 2021 Best Workplaces in the Bay Area and 2021 Forbes #4 Best Startup Employers, Curology is a leader in direct-to-consumer eCommerce and has been featured in Vogue, Allure, Harper’s Bazaar, and Business Insider. We collaborate to achieve our goals and strive to embody our core values: Accountability, Team First & Inclusivity.

title: Associate Brand Manager
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing...**


As an Associate Brand Manager, you will support the Head of Brand Strategy for Verizon Value Business volume brands and play a vital role in contributing to the brand portfolio marketing strategy for Straight Talk, Tracfone, Walmart Family Mobile, and SafeLink. Your primary responsibilities will include the below.


Brand Portfolio Strategy and Messaging Innovation:

* Supporting the development of the Value volume brand portfolio marketing strategy to ensure marketing plans address overall business objectives and priorities.
* Supporting the implementation of messaging strategies to drive performance including ownership of brand value proposition messaging evolution and evangelization.
* Analyzing competitor messaging and across industry innovation to make Verizon Value best in class.
* Partnering with the commercial team to align messaging, naming, and brand strategy with the business needs.
* Supporting the development and maintenance of the marketing calendar to ensure brands are delivering consumers the messages needed to drive business results.


Brand Compliance

* Brand stewardship and evangelization amongst the organization to ensure understanding of our target audience, brand strategy, brand guidelines, and policies for creative development and review.
* Reviewing messaging in briefs and creative from internal and external partners to ensure alignment to segmentation strategy and brand guidelines. Acting as a steward of the brand, ensuring consistency with each piece.
* Supporting messaging audits, branded content development, and other brand implementation tasks.
* Working with legal to ensure messaging is delivering clear, consumable information. Maintaining up to date disclosure libraries to ensure the marketing team is delivering creative aligned to legal restrictions.


Brand Optimization:

* Working with our creative agencies and internal marketing team to optimize and improve messaging performance.
* Aligning messaging with brand positioning, strategy, and voice.
* Providing recommendations based on audience targets and product proof points.
* Supporting briefing insights team on messaging and creative studies needed. Applying learnings from Insights teams to optimize brand performance.
* Reviewing of marketing briefs to ensure alignment with brand strategy, messaging proof points.


Competitor and Trend Monitoring:

* Staying ahead of industry approaches by monitoring competitors and trends.
* Innovating messaging strategies to maintain a competitive edge.


Support New Product Positioning:

* Assisting in defining positioning and messaging for new products.
* Ensuring messaging is data-driven and informed by consumer insights.


Reporting and Presentation:

* Compile and support presentation of brand strategy plans and results to executives as needed.

### **This role may be considered as part of the Department of Defense SkillBridge Program.**

**Where you’ll be working…**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.

### **What we’re looking for...**


You’ll need to have:

* Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
* Four or more years of relevant work experience.
* Willingness to travel approximately up to 25%.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Brand portfolio management experience.
* Telecommunications experience.
* Self-motivated, driven, and able to work independently.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficiency in Google platforms (Slides, Docs, etc.).
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
* Exceptional sense of urgency and problem-solving skills.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.


Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island or Washington work location, the compensation range for this position is between $93,000.00 and $189,000.00 annually based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.

title: Actors/Content Creators Wanted For TikTok Ads!
description:
Got a passion for acting and creating content?

**This is the perfect opportunity for actors, beginner content creators, and beginner UGC creators.**

**Grab this opportunity to shoot content in the health and wellness space and get paid!**

We are a talent agency looking for charismatic and energetic actors/actresses based in the US and Canada.

You will need to have a strong understanding of the TikTok platform and a smartphone with a high-quality camera to shoot content.

If that's you and you're interested in

* getting paid to shoot content from your phone
* getting free health products
* being able to work from home on your own hours (as long as you submit projects on time)

Then we would like to work with you!

Our clients include top US health brands that have been featured in Forbes, Buzzfeed, GQ, Men's Health, and more.

Still interested? Here's how this works:

* You will be given a creative brief to execute and a set number of hours to complete the brief.
* You just need to read the script and upload the content to our drive on or before the deadline.
* No editing required!
* Once the content has been approved, you will receive your payment via Fiverr.

If all goes well, you can look forward to future collaborations.

Note:  
\\*We do **NOT** pay per video.  
**\\*\\*We do not need you to edit/put the ads together.**  
**\\*\\*\\*We do not need you to write the scripts, creative briefs are provided by our team.**

You just need to be engaging when reading the scripts, follow the instructions on the creative brief, and upload the content to our drive!

\\*\\***Familiarity with TikTok is a must** and previous experience shooting ads is a plus!  
\\*\\*Applicants without video examples of past work will not be entertained.

We look forward to hearing from you!  
The Hyperscale Team

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $28.00 - $35.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Application Question(s):

* Are you comfortable reading scripts in front of the camera and filming B-Roll?
* Do you understand that this is a per hour role?
* This job will require you to have a smartphone with a good quality camera. What model smartphone do you use to shoot content?
* Please provide a link to your portfolio of work. If you do not have one, drop a link to a video of you speaking/endorsing a product. Applicants without examples will not be entertained. We don't need you to email them at a later time or look anywhere else other than this field for your portfolio. Applicants who do not follow instructions will not be entertained.

Work Location: Remote

title: Copywriter - Social Media Content Writer
description:
**Brandout Social** is currently hiring for a **part-time Remote Copywriter - Social Media Content Writer** to research, write, and edit content for a variety of projects, including print, web, mobile, video, and social media in the **Colorado Springs, CO** area. This content writing position earns a **competitive base pay** of **$20/hour** with additional bonuses.


In addition to **competitive pay** and our **ambitious, collaborative culture**, we offer our Copywriters - Social Media Content Writers the following benefits:

* **Retirement plan**
* **Flexible work schedule**
* **Performance bonuses**


So, now that you've learned the who, what, where, and why, you may be wondering HOW to apply for this content writing job? It's easy! If you have a bachelor's degree in a related field as well as copywriting experience, just fill out our initial **mobile-friendly online application**. We hope to meet you soon!

 **DAY-TO-DAY**


This content writing position works a remote, **flexible, part-time schedule**. You would work approximately 20 hours a week.


As a Copywriter - Social Media Content Writer, you provide a vital service to our clients. They need to get the word out about their transformative services, and you are here to help. Each day, you raise the bar on creativity, writing fresh copy that connects with each client's audience and drives that audience to action. When first taking on a project, you perform research and do interviews so that you can better understand the client and their target audience. Using your versatile copywriting style, you then create content for our client in the form of a wide variety of marketing and communication materials.


Often, you brainstorm with your team to spark ideas and achieve a just-right tone. The copy you create is then presented to the client and your team for review. Always eager to grow and improve, you implement their feedback, making changes and adjustments until everyone is satisfied we've hit the mark. Once that happens, you help build out the client's calendar and schedule the content to post to social media. The turnaround time for your content writing is short, but you enjoy the fast pace of your work and the energizing feel of those creative juices flowing. You also find great satisfaction in knowing you're making a difference in so many lives!

 **ABOUT BRANDOUT SOCIAL**


At Brandout Social, we believe in humans making a human connection! Our mission is to build connections between our clients and their patients. Thousands of people have spent their time, energy, and money seeking successful pain management through self-medication, and we hope to connect them to the transformative power of chiropractic care. We partner with doctors to help them better connect with patients, and our creative gurus provide marketing and education to ensure full waiting rooms with patients awaiting personalized care!


We could not be successful in achieving our mission without our exceptional team! Our employees are **talented, enthusiastic, and creative**! We pride ourselves in maintaining a **collaborative work environment** where our employees feel free to **flex their design and creative muscles** and are supported by a **positive, team-oriented, and flexible** atmosphere.

 **OUR IDEAL COPYWRITER - SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT WRITER**

* Collaborative - excited to connect all the dots to bring complex projects together
* Organized and punctual - manages multiple tasks and meets deadlines with room to spare
* Adaptable - works with confidence in a fast-paced setting
* Creative - innovative thinker that thinks outside of the box
* Attentive - keen eye for detail and an appreciation of great copywriting design


If this sounds like you, keep reading about this amazing content writing opportunity!

 **REQUIREMENTS FOR A COPYWRITER - SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT WRITER**

* Bachelor's degree in journalism, English, communications, or a related discipline
* 1+ years of professional copywriting experience and a solid portfolio of work
* Exceptional content writing and research skills
* Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Adobe Acrobat Pro


Social media or content marketing experience would be a plus. Proofreading experience and familiarity with standard style guides would also be a plus. If you meet the above requirements, we need your phenomenally unique copywriting skills. Apply today to join our team!

title: Community Manager & Social Strategist
description:
**Community Manager & Social Strategist**

Thryfty is an online e-commerce brand focused on being creative and bringing unique styles to our community. Our brand exists to build confidence and bring fun into everyday style. To do this, we need help showing off our products and engaging with our community through unique and consistent content. We are looking for a full-time Community Manager & Social Strategist to take us to the next level. We offer a flexible work schedule during the week.

**Why Our Team Needs You**

We have grown significantly recently and want to do everything we can to maintain our social growth while staying engaged with our current community and we need you to step in and help us make this happen. The Thryfty team will rely on you to ensure high-quality engagement and that a well-thought-out strategy is used to create an environment that resonates with Thryfty.

**What You’ll Do**

You’ll work alongside our other managers to ensure a cohesive brand direction is planned and executed. You will also be a resource for our pods and enable them to execute their projects to their fullest potential. As the Community Manager and Social Strategist you’ll be responsible for planning our social calendar, conceptualizing briefs and ideas, and assessing performance metrics. You’ll use your findings to continuously improve and imagine ways to drive the brand forward. We’ll expect you to maintain the world we create as we take on new projects and collections for the brand. An area we’d like to see you thrive is to utilize social media to help create seeding lists and engage with high-quality creators. Your goal is to make Thryfty known as not only a great place to get fashion pieces, but also a source of inspiration, desire, and community.

A typical routine may involve working with team pods for final release execution, communicating regularly with other team managers so everyone remains in alignment, and meeting with brand owners to discuss new projects and performance. You’ll be expected to collaborate with the team from ideation to content distribution that drives engagement. You’ll be responsible for considering how customers will engage with our pages and keeping a pulse on social trends. We want you to maintain the close-knit support we provide for our dedicated followers through responding to comments, DMs, and post sharing as well as building from the ground up a presence for Thryfty on new platforms our audiences are a part of like Discord.

**What You’ve Done**

You regularly stay plugged into the streetwear and fashion industry as well as new changes with social media platforms. You’ve also created content in-platform before and pay attention to the small details of content creation that lead to big impacts and can pick apart key indicators to what makes effective performing content. You have reached out to ideal creators for engagement and understand who would make a good partnership for Thryfty.

Ideally, you have had experience with a remote team and consider yourself to be a planner. You’re known for being great at coming up with ideas and being someone who executes their visions. Of course, you work well on a collaborative team and are into streetwear fashion, and understand the Thryfty community.

**Preferred Experience**

We don’t require experience with the platforms we use, but if you do, we want to know about it.

Here is a list of what we use frequently:

● ClickUp

● Slack

● Google Drive

● Vibe Canvas

● Zoom / Google Meet

● Instagram

● TikTok

● Discord

● CapCut

**Further Details**

● *Working Hours*: Flexible (may need to be available for team discussions between

9am-5pm EST)

● *Pay Range:* Varies based on experience

Job Type: Contract

Application Question(s):

* Why did you decide you'd like to apply for this position? What particularly about your experience makes you feel like you could handle the responsibilities?

Work Location: Remote

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
ELB Learning is hiring a Customer Success Manager to join our Account Management team. As a Customer Success Manager, your primary responsibility will be to ensure our customers renew their subscriptions. You will do this by onboarding new clients, ensuring they are aware of new features, overcoming obstacles for adoption, and ensuring customers realize value from their investment. You will work directly with customers to ensure they stay up to date with the latest product enhancements and best practices. You will also work closely with a cross-functional team of Account Executives, Professional Services, Product Support, and Marketing specialists to drive innovative product development, build awareness for our suite of software products, and reveal new growth opportunities. Our team is fueled with a passion and dedication to making our customers successful.


ELB Learning offers an industry-leading suite of products and services that empowers our customers to create and deliver immersive, engaging, and effective learning. We serve businesses seeking to train employees, educational institutions teaching students, and even independent contractors who produce learning content. Through software solutions such as course authoring, gamification, asynchronous video coaching, and virtual reality, we make it easy for business leaders and educators to create better learning experiences. We also build bespoke training content for our customers.


How is success in this role measured?

* Percentage of initial revenue renewed


What you will do to achieve success?

* Renewal Management: Initiate renewal conversations as customer’s subscriptions are expiring, manage renewal discussions, and work to ensure customers renew their subscriptions.
* Account Growth: Identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling additional products or services to existing customers, based on their evolving needs, and notify Account Executives.
* Onboarding and Training: Help new customers get started with the learning technology by providing onboarding sessions and training to familiarize them with the platform's features and capabilities.
* Success Planning: Collaborate with customers to develop success plans that outline their objectives, key milestones, and strategies to achieve them using the learning technology.
* Needs Assessment: Understand the specific needs and goals of each customer and tailor the use of the learning technology to meet those objectives.
* Account Management: Serve as the primary point of contact for customers, maintaining a strong relationship and ensuring their ongoing satisfaction with the product or service.
* User Engagement: Develop strategies to increase user engagement with the learning technology, which can include creating content, gamification, and communication plans.
* Customer Feedback Collection: Gather feedback from customers to gain insights into their experiences, pain points, and areas for improvement, and then communicate this feedback to the product development team.
* Adoption and Utilization Tracking: Monitor and analyze customer usage data to ensure that customers are effectively utilizing the technology and achieving their goals.
* Identify Customer Renewal Risk: Work with extended ELB team to create and execute on “get well” plans.

Requirements  

Other attributes that will help you succeed in this role:

* Good at maintaining relationships
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* A high level of emotional intelligence
* Proactive in identifying and addressing potential issues
* The ability to self-manage time, priorities, and tasks
* Strong problem identification and resolution skills
* A positive, team-centric attitude

Salary Description
$45,000 - $55,000 annually

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
**Career Fulfillment & Culture**
--------------------------------


People come to work for Deque because of what we do: enable businesses and organizations to make their sites and apps accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities. The personal fulfillment employees feel here is unparalleled. In addition to the altruistic nature of our jobs, the organizational structure is extremely flat and welcoming. Women-owned and operated, Deque CEO Preety Kumar is internationally revered for her down-to-earth personality and work ethic. Deque's core values are central to our culture of customer satisfaction. Do you share them?

* Innovation with results that matter
* Deliver what you promise
* Can-do attitude
* Open, direct & respectful communications
* We care deeply
* We practice humility


At Deque, you’ll work with the best and brightest minds in the industry, sharing best practices, tackling new issues and uncovering new approaches. Accessibility Consultants at Deque also love their jobs because of the support systems in place.


Deque experts regularly contribute to W3C Accessibility Working Groups and collectively hold more CPACC, WAS, & CPWA certifications issued by the IAAP than any accessibility testing company in the world.

**Position Description**
------------------------


Deque is looking for a new addition to the Marketing team. In this role you will create compelling, discoverable content that helps generate awareness and demand for Deque product, services, and training.  

As a key member of a small, but mighty Marketing team, you will help create amazing core content for deque.com, for Deque thought leaders and for social media. This position reports to the Marketing lead.  

Our ideal candidate for the Content Marketing Manager position is an excellent writer with an eye for design and some B2B tech experience. This candidate will need to be able to collaborate with Product Management and other Subject Matter Experts to help continually improve the deque.com experience.

**Primary Responsibilities**
----------------------------

* Collaborate with Product Managers to create content that is optimized for Search, informs consideration stages and drives conversion.
* Impose and reinforce a consistent information architecture, style and tone.
* Work in the WordPress CMS to publish your content using pre-existing content modules.
* Contribute to the editorial calendar.
* Contribute to Blog strategy and management.
* Aid social media content support.
* Aid Deque Thought Leadership content support.
* Report on activities and outcomes with stakeholders like Leadership and Product Management.

**Requirements**
----------------

* 4+ years of experience creating stellar content and webpages in B2B tech.
* Experience with Content Management Systems like WordPress.
* Experience with web analytics and reporting systems like Google Analytics.
* Experience writing with SEO in mind.
* Experience creating targeted, early-funnel content.

**About Deque**
---------------


Deque (pronounced dee-cue) is a web accessibility software and services company, and our mission is Digital Equality. We believe everyone, regardless of their ability, should have equal access to the information, services, applications, and everything else on the web.  

We work with enterprise-level businesses and organizations to ensure that their sites and mobile apps are accessible. With over 475,000 extensions installed and over 5,000 audit projects completed, Deque is the industry standard. Join our growing family as we work to make the web a better place for everyone.

**Job Location**
----------------

* Remote

**How to Apply**
----------------

* Apply by submitting your resume and a cover letter. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered.

**In your cover letter**
------------------------

* Explain your interest in joining Deque and how you align with our Core Values
* Depict key attributes that differentiate you as a candidate


Deque is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Reference and background checks will be required. The expected salary range is 90K - 100K but is subject to change based on the skills, abilities, and experience of each candidate. The values listed are not intended to guarantee a salary for candidates or current employees.


Thank you for your interest in joining our exciting company!

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
Description:

As a Content Marketer, you'll own strategic content initiatives and will also be heavily involved in shaping the future of Blip’s brand voice. One of your first projects will be on the strategy and execution of content campaigns aimed at franchises nationwide.

**Who is Blip?**


Blip is a two-sided marketplace for accessing billboards on-demand. (Think: AirBnB for digital signs!) Advertisers can use our platform to upload and send ads to digital signs all across the country, including Times Square.


With this marketplace we serve two customers:

* Advertisers – we have democratized access to billboards so that for the first time in history, a startup shoe company can occupy the same ad space as Nike does. May the best ideas and products win, regardless of who has the largest marketing budget!
* Media Owners – this novel source of advertising demand (our Marketplace) creates new revenue streams for sign owners that they don’t have to pay to acquire, allowing these small business owners to put more cash in their pockets for their mortgage, family vacations, and kids’ college tuition.

**Blip culture:**

* We put customers first
* We focus on experience before revenue
* We take ownership
* We dive deep
* We work well together
* We set clear expectations, and we inspect them
* We deliver results

**More on your role:**

* Design and execute a comprehensive content marketing strategy aligned with target personas and business goals
* Produce high-quality, engaging, and SEO-optimized content for various channels, including sales collateral, website pages, and social media
* Drive content creation for digital platforms, ensuring consistency in brand voice and messaging
* Dive deep into data analytics to assess content performance, iterate and optimize for maximum impact
* Challenge the status quo by exploring innovative approaches to content creation and distribution
* Take ownership of the content calendar, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality material


Requirements:
**Successful Candidates will likely have:**

* Two years of experience creating content
* Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a distinct writing style/voice
* Knowledge of SEO’s relationship with Content, and social media best practices
* Big ideas
* A propensity for ownership

**Employee Benefits!**

* Comprehensive insurance coverage (health, vision, dental) with premiums covered
* Equity options for all full-time employees
* Flexible paid time off
* Fitness stipend
* Paid parental leave

title: Social Media Manager
description:
Plume Health is a passion-fueled, mission-driven company that is trans-founded and focused on radically increasing access to healthcare for the trans community, supporting a bold, authentic and healthy lifestyle. We hope to make gender-affirming hormone therapy easily accessible at the touch of a button in every state of the US. We are an organization by and for trans folks and we want heart-forward, awesomely talented teammates to join us on our journey.  

This work is deeply personal and heart-driven, and we want teammates who, above all else, care about the mission and the people we serve. For the right candidates, we present a rare opportunity to do well by doing good. Plume offers an affirming, trans-centered, culturally inclusive and fun work environment filled with purpose.  

We are seeking a creative and strategic Social Media Manager to join our team. As the Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing social media strategies to enhance brand awareness, engage with our audience, and drive business objectives. You will oversee all aspects of our social media presence across various platforms, ensuring consistency in messaging and branding while staying up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in social media marketing. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of social media analytics, excellent communication skills, understanding of the transgender and gender-non-conforming community, and a passion for storytelling.
### **Responsibilities: Strategy and Planning**

* Develop and execute comprehensive organic social media strategies aligned with company goals.
* Stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities.
* Plan and execute social media campaigns to promote products, events, or initiatives.
* Ensure inclusivity and sensitivity in campaigns, particularly towards the TGNC community. Ensure campaigns are accessible to a broad range of experiences.

### **Responsibilities: Content Management**

* Create, curate, and schedule engaging and shareable content across platforms.
* Collaborate with the Marketing team and graphic agency to create visually appealing and on-brand content.
* Oversee day-to-day execution of social media content by scheduling posts.
* Monitor and optimize posting times for maximum reach and engagement.
* Integrate social media into broader marketing campaigns.

### **Responsibilities: Community Engagement and Analytics**

* Monitor social media channels for brand mentions and relevant conversations.
* Respond to comments, messages, and inquiries promptly and professionally.
* Cultivate positive relationships with the online community.
* Track key social media metrics, analyze performance reports, and provide insights for improvement.
* Provide weekly insights and recommendations to enhance social media effectiveness.

### **The Social Media Manager will be responsible for the following Key Process Indicators (KPIs)**

* Follower Growth: Increase in the number of followers across social media platforms over time.
* Engagement Rate: Measure the level of interaction (likes, comments, shares, etc.) per post relative to the total number of followers.
* Reach: Measure the total number of people who have seen the content posted by the social media manager.
* Click-Through Rate (CTR): Measure the percentage of users who click on a link or call-to-action in a social media post.
* Customer Sentiment: Monitor and analyze comments, mentions, and messages to gauge overall sentiment towards the brand or organization.
* Content Performance: Evaluate the performance of individual posts or content types to identify what resonates best with the audience.
* Response Time: Measure the average time it takes for the social media manager to respond to inquiries or comments.
* Social media referral traffic: Measure the effectiveness of social media campaigns in achieving specific goals (e.g., product promotion, event attendance, etc.).

### **Qualifications**

* At least three years of proven experience as an effective Social Media Manager or in a similar role.
* Familiarity with social media management tools and analytics platforms.
* In-depth knowledge of social media platforms, trends, and best practices, specifically Instagram, TikTok, Reddit and Threads.
* Experience working with Product teams to determine data sources and operations for data collection and visualization.
* Ability to analyze data and derive insights to improve strategy.
* Strong project management skills, leading with and holding oneself and others accountable to clear goals, deadlines, and cross-functional accountabilities.
* Strong creative skills with an eye for visual aesthetics.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated success in growing and engaging social media audiences. Healthcare industry and/or member subscription industry is a plus.

**Benefits and Perks:**  

Ground-Floor Equity for all employees (Series B)
Free Medical, Dental, Vision for employees
Unlimited PTO
11 paid holidays and company shut-down for a week in December
401(k)
Free Plume and Mental Health Subscriptions
The best coworkers you could imagine, if you love fiercely intelligent, heart-open, mission-driven collaborators.  

  

Plume is an equal-opportunity employer. Trans and gender-nonconforming individuals are strongly encouraged to apply, particularly those who identify as people of color. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law. We will provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities upon request. Please let us know if you require any accommodations to apply or interview for this position.  

Discover more about Plume at www.getplume.co and become part of our award-winning journey towards transforming healthcare for every trans life. Join us today in shaping the future of healthtech and LGBTQ+ care!

title: Content Manager
description:
**Summary:**
Reporting to the Senior Director of Editorial, the Content Manager will play a crucial role in enhancing our digital presence and optimizing our overall strategy. The Content Manager will have a dual focus on site optimization and day-to-day content planning, ensuring that our digital assets are engaging, relevant and aligned with our brand's vision. This role will work with colleagues in the Consumer & Digital team, the Brand & Social Marketing teams and key external partners and agencies – all offering best-in-class tools and expertise.**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:****Site Optimization:*** Analyzing KPIs to ensure proper page setup, including refining content organization and implementing broader UX enhancement.
* Conducting regular site audits to identify areas for improvement.
* Monitoring site performance metrics and user engagement.
* Optimizing site navigation and user experience.
* Collaborating with Product Manager and developers to implement site enhancements and fixes.
* Reviewing and implementing SEO improvements and A-B testing data to determine what's effective and what isn't, with a keen eye on identifying high-performing keywords and phrases.
* Presenting key findings in a succinct way to stakeholders alongside drawing out insights and solutions when appropriate.
* Marrying data with consumer behavior and actions to support the ongoing optimization of fan features on the website and app.

**Day-to-day content planning:*** Developing and executing day-to-day content planning, ensuring it aligns with current trends and events in the tennis world, while also supporting our overall marketing and branding strategies.
* Monitoring various sources, including results, news, video feeds and social posts to identify trending and buzz-worthy content that we can leverage for our brand; if deemed valuable, taking proactive steps to integrate it into our platform.
* Ensuring we and our social media presence are up to date with emerging content opportunities and trends.
* Providing feedback on art, headlines, copy and video; working to package this content in a manner that captivates the audience and drives users deep into the site.
* Collaborating with partners to create and curate relevant and engaging content for the website.
* Maintaining consistent style and quality control across all digital platforms.


**Education and Experience:*** Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications or a related field required.
* Minimum of 2-3 experience in website optimization, SEO, and content management.

 **Required Skills and Competencies:*** Possess strong content judgment and the ability to quickly prioritize and package various types of output for a large global audience.
* Proficiency in email marketing platforms and best practices.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
* Excellent project management and organizational skills.
* Creative mindset with an eye for design and visual aesthetics.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Passion for tennis and knowledge of the WTA is a plus.
* Copywriting skills that are versatile. The candidate needs to be able to adapt instantly to the brand’s tone of voice with flawless grammar, spelling and punctuation mixed with a touch of creativity.
* We’re looking for imagination and creative spark, but with a sharp eye for detail, ability to prioritize, work in a team, manage with feedback, see the bigger picture, and stay calm under pressure.

 **Travel Requirements:**
None  

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**
None  

**Position Type/Work Schedule:**
Full Time, 40 hours a week. Typical schedule will be Monday-Friday. Must be available for occasional evenings/weekends.**Work Environment/Physical Demands:**
Work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Working Conditions
The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. The passage of employees through the work area is average and normal.

Physical Demands
The employee is required to sit for long periods; use close/distant vision; hear using the telephone; bend at the waist and knee; communicate verbally and electronically with worldwide constituency; use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone keyboard. Must be able to lift 50 lbs.

The WTA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  

  

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.
*WTA Ventures was founded as a joint venture partnership between the WTA Tour and private equity firm CVC Capital Partners, in March 2023. WTA Ventures manage the commercial aspects of women's tennis, in order to develop and grow the sport worldwide.*

title: Senior Content Marketing Manager
description:
**PandaDoc is in search of a Senior Content Marketing Manager who will be responsible for creating, managing, and optimizing content to effectively convey our brand messaging and engage our target audience, thereby supporting PandaDoc's growth goals.** In this role, you will spearhead the development and execution of a comprehensive content strategy with the overarching objectives of enhancing brand visibility, increasing engagement, and generating leads. Collaboration with stakeholders from revenue marketing, product marketing, and product management is essential to produce compelling copy, encompassing various formats such as blogs, case studies, nurture email series, white papers, newsletters, product launches, press releases, and more.



Our ideal candidate is a motivated and creative content marketer with a proven track record of leveraging data and insights to craft compelling content tailored to specific target audiences. This position will report directly to the Director of Brand Marketing. Join PandaDoc and contribute to our mission of driving growth through impactful and strategic content marketing.


**In this role, you will:**
---------------------------


* Conduct a thorough analysis of business objectives, target audience preferences, and industry trends to inform a holistic content strategy.
* Implement robust analytics solutions to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and iterate content strategies based on data-driven insights.
* Prioritize gathering detailed market research and customer insights to create targeted, relevant content that resonates with specific audience segments.
* Establish a content calendar with a diverse mix of content types while maintaining a cohesive brand voice and messaging across all materials.
* Develop personalized content pathways aligned with the buyer's journey stages to guide leads through a tailored and impactful experience.
* Implement a strategic and coordinated approach to content distribution, ensuring a presence across relevant platforms such as social, email and web to maximize visibility and engagement.
* Closely collaborate with the revenue marketing team to align content initiatives with broader campaigns, ensuring a unified and consistent brand message.
* Establish regular communication channels with product managers, sales teams, and subject matter experts to remain informed about product developments, industry trends, and valuable customer feedback.
* Implement efficient content creation workflows, emphasizing collaboration and adherence to deadlines to streamline the production process (ideation and research to drafting, editing and final publication).

**About you:**
--------------


* Over 5 years of content marketing experience, with a preference for candidates who have worked in a B2B SaaS environment.
* Demonstrated success in crafting engaging and tailored content for specific target audiences to drive meaningful engagement.
* Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills demonstrated through a portfolio featuring a diverse range of content types, including blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, and email campaigns.
* Proficient in utilizing analytics tools to measure content effectiveness and drive data-driven decision-making.
* Experience in A/B testing and optimizing content based on performance metrics.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills enabling effective work with internal teams, external partners, and subject matter experts.
* Demonstrated ability to distill complex information into clear and compelling messages.
* Expertise in crafting and executing multichannel content distribution strategies, encompassing social media, email marketing, webinars, and partnerships.
* Experience with content creation across earned, owned and paid channels.


**The annual base salary range for this position is $90K - $115k USD**


**Company Overview:**
---------------------



PandaDoc empowers more than 40,000 growing organizations to thrive by taking the work out of document workflow. PandaDoc provides an all-in-one document workflow automation platform that helps fast scaling teams accelerate the ability to create, manage, and sign digital documents including proposals, quotes, contracts, and more. For more information, please visit https://www.pandadoc.com.


**Company Culture:**
--------------------



We're known for our work-life balance, kind co-workers, & creative virtual team-bonding events. And although our Pandas are located across the globe, we stay connected with the help of technology and ensure that everyone on our team feels, well, like a team.



Pandas work best when they're happy. We retain our talent by upholding our values of integrity & transparency, and selling a product that changes the lives of our customers.



Check out our LinkedIn to learn more.


**Benefits:**
-------------


Employees may be able to purchase company stock (or receive annual bonuses)
Employees (and their families) may enroll in the company's medical, dental, vision, short & long term disability, life insurance, FSA and 401k plans.
Employees will also receive 13.34+ hours of paid time off per month, 6 self care days, birthday PTO day, and 12 company paid holidays off per year
**PandaDoc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law.


**EXTERNAL RECRUITERS**


**Approval Requirement**



The use of external recruiters/staffing agencies requires prior approval from our HR Team. The HR Team at PandaDoc requests that external recruiters/staffing agencies not to contact PandaDoc employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. Complying with this request will be a factor in determining future professional relationships with PandaDoc.


**Applications Deadline 3/29**

title: Digital Content Coordinator
description:
**Job Title**

Digital Content Coordinator


**Reports To**

Senior Director, Marketing


**Job Purpose**

We are seeking a talented and imaginative Digital Content Coordinator that will play an integral role in the implementation and execution of digital marketing content. As the Digital Content Coordinator, you are responsible for creating high quality content for website pages, social media posts, product campaigns, and newsletters. In this role, you will utilize data and analytic tools to track content performance, user engagement, and other metrics. You will use these insights to optimize content strategies and enhance audience participation as they move from awareness to engagement within the marketing funnel. The ideal candidate commands a knack for breaking down big, complex concepts into engaging content deliverables.


**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Generate high-quality, SEO-optimized content for website pages, social media posts, product campaigns, and newsletters
* Write, proofread, and edit all marketing materials, emails, website, and social content
* Maintain the Marketing content calendar
* Manage and oversee organizational intranet and ensure accuracy and efficiency for product marketing content
* Work closely with subject matter experts, product managers, designers, and other internal teams to ensure materials are compelling and aligned with the Payroc brand and messaging
* Identify and segment audiences and verticals based on user behavior and content preferences
* This position requires a candidate that is extremely detail-oriented and thorough. If that is you, please include the word pear at the very top of your cover letter for further consideration
* Utilize analytics tools to monitor and assess the performance of campaigns, newsletters, and blog posts, making data-driven recommendations to optimize strategies
* Keep up to date with industry trends, emerging platforms, and best practices to ensure our digital content strategy remains innovative and competitive

**What You’ll Receive**

* Dedicated and consistent support for questions, personal development, and career growth. Anywhere you want to go within our organization, we have a commitment to getting you the knowledge, training, and resources to get there.
* Collaboration! Our marketing team is a passionate collection of innovative minds. We think strategically, act collaboratively, and have a lot of fun in between!
* Flexibility to work anywhere! As a fully remote team, we understand that flexibility enhances our team member’s physical, emotional, and mental well-being.
* Compensation and comprehensive benefits! At Payroc, we work diligently to guarantee our compensation package is one of the best in the industry.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, or related field
* 1-3 years of experience creating digital content in the B2B space
* Stellar written and verbal communication skills
* Detail-oriented work style with exceptional time management and organizational expertise
* Extensive knowledge of social media platforms and best practices
* Self-motivated, creative, and results-driven
* Microsoft Suite of tools: PowerPoint, Excel and Canva
* Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and details simultaneously
* Strong understanding of CMS environments
* Firm understanding of campaign coordination and asset gathering

**Travel Component**

* N/A

**Job Classification**

* Exempt

At Payroc we are committed to the principal of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individuals’ qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental, or sensory disability, sexual orientation or any other status protected by the laws regulation in the location we operate. Payroc does not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.


Payroc is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, contact Human Resources Department at HR@payroc.com

title: Content & Communications Manager
description:
We exist for American workers and their employers - who are the backbone of our economy. That is where Centivo comes in - our mission is to bring affordable, high-quality healthcare to the millions of Americans who struggle to pay their healthcare bills.


We are looking for Content and Communications Manager to own the content calendar and set the strategy for earned channels. This role is ideal for B2B content marketer with expertise in crafting demand generation content, along with thought leadership pieces and PR. A foundational grasp of the employer healthcare market and trends, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment are essential for success in this position.


**Responsibilities Include:**


**Content Strategy:**


* Develop a comprehensive content strategy to tell the story of our product/brand promise to engage prospects and other audiences.
* Understand our audiences and create content that resonates with them.
* Stay up to date on industry trends and competitor activities to ensure content relevance.


**Content Creation:**

* Lead high-impact, strategic campaign projects, including the development of marketing briefs, storyboards, and talking points and coordination with internal and external stakeholders.
* Produce high-quality written, visual and digital content for various channels (website, social, email, etc.) in partnership with design/creative teams and external agencies/freelancers.
* Handle multiple projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment, including campaigns with varying size and scope.
* Ensure all content is on-message, and consistent in style, quality and tone.


**Communications Management:**


* Manage external communication channels to maintain a unified voice
* Set the strategy for earned, shared, and owned channels.
* Develop and maintain media relationships with media outlets, influencers and key stakeholders
* Craft press releases, articles and other communication materials as needed.
* Ensure consistency in messaging across all communication channels.


**Qualifications:**


* 5-7 years of experience in communications, marketing, journalism, or an advertising agency.
* Excellent written, grammatical, and editorial skills and understanding of the various of channels and type of content based on goals & objectives. Additionally, great oral and listening skills.
* Healthcare experience required, employer healthcare market experience preferred.
* Experience in working in a dynamic and fast paced environment with the ability to meet deadlines and adapt to evolving priorities


**Work Location:**


* This position is remote

**Pay Transparency**  

The ranges we place in our job postings reflect what we anticipate to be the minimum to maximum of the base salary for this role. Additionally, our overall benefits package includes a few things you may consider towards a total compensation such as bonus, health benefits (some employer paid), PTO, and equity option grants.

**Salary Range**


$95,000—$105,000 USD**Who we are:**



Centivo is an innovative health plan for self-funded employers on a mission to bring affordable, high-quality healthcare to the millions of working Americans who struggle to pay their medical bills. Anchored around a primary care based ACO model, Centivo saves employers 15 to 30 percent compared to traditional insurance carriers. Employees also realize significant savings through our free primary care (including virtual), predictable copay and no-deductible benefit plan design. Centivo works with employers ranging in size from 51 employees to Fortune 500 companies. For more information, visit centivo.com.
  

  

Headquartered in Buffalo, NY with offices in New York City and Buffalo, Centivo is backed by leading healthcare and technology investors, including a recent round of investment from Morgan Health, a business unit of JPMorgan Chase & Co.

title: PR & Communications Manager (Remote USA)
description:
Do you have a passion for storytelling and a desire to not only inform but also inspire customers, influencers, stakeholders, and internal teams? Fluke and Fluke Reliability are seeking a PR & Communications Manager to join its Brand & Communications Team. This role will be responsible for developing, organizing, and executing strategic communications programs including media engagements and appearances at industry, analyst, government, and thought leadership events. They will lead the media outreach strategy for Fluke holistically, working with our regional PR agencies globally and internal marketing teams to execute plans that increase our reach, brand awareness, and credibility in the market. The right candidate will work directly with leadership, experts and across regional stakeholders, serving as an integral part of the wider Marketing team.
  
  

The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, well-seasoned communications professional who possesses sound judgment and impeccable writing skills. The PR & Communications Manager will be instrumental in safeguarding and enhancing the reputation of Fluke on a global basis. They will take abstract and complicated issues and turn them into simple, powerful, and stand-out narratives that are easily digested by their intended audience. They will also help ensure all external messaging is aligned across the business.
  
  

Reporting to the Head of External Communications, this role will work on a highly collaborative and consultative basis with peers in marketing, as well as experts in our global business functions and regional teams, communicating the global communications vision and ensuring regional stories are told.
  
  

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
  

* Reporting to the head of External communications, responsible for the global PR & communications strategy and plan – establishing Fluke as a thought leader
* Management of regional PR agencies (North America and EMEA), being the point person for the press office function day-to-day
* Think of innovative ways for us to appear in business, technology, and trades media and own our global press lists for these.
* Provide communications expertise, support, and advice to the wider Marketing team to translate complex messages into clear, concise communications suitable for global audiences
* Keep a finger on the pulse of what’s happening within the business as well as the broader Fluke and Fortive businesses – connecting with marketing, Sales, HR and Product Management leaders to proactively initiate communications to ensure customers are excited about what is coming down the pipeline
* Ensure a steady pipeline of company news: industry awards, product launches, customer stories/sign-on’s, surveys on an external basis to drive interest, engagement and credibility – managing our communications calendar
* Assist at corporate events for both Fluke and Fluke Reliability annually.
* Maintain a steady in-flow of topics and subject matter expert speakers for Best Practice Webinar series
* Manage events coordinator (contract employee) to carry out events execution and logistics planning for our Best Practice Webinar series.
* Partner with Fluke and Fluke Reliability channel partners on PR & communications plans as appropriate
* Partner closely with Content Manager to align their marketing content strategy with external communications strategy/calendar and plan what articles, editorials, blogs posts, are needed from the Content team for PR outreach
* Will be required to help draft external messaging on external presentations for senior executives across global audiences, including driving the creation and delivery of compelling, executive-level presentation materials (slides, scripts, messaging documents, and customer stories) for senior leadership
* Own the yearly primary research initiative, to power our PR with data, driving team members to collaborate as necessary.
* Manage company reporting platforms and report out to various stakeholders monthly.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  
  

* Minimum of 5+ years of communications, public relations, or journalism experience
* Bachelor’s degree in Journalism, English, Communications, or a related field desired
* Significant experience in corporate communications, global experience preferred but particularly in North America
* Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
* Expertise in influencer marketing
* Superior judgment in all situations – protecting the reputation of the business and influencing at a senior level
* Appreciation of developing trends in the media and for communications in general, including the importance of content, social media, and digital, alongside more traditional channels
* Demonstrated creativity in driving communications and thought leadership activity
* Proven experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines and shifting priorities as business needs evolve
* Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams within the organization, senior leadership, external agencies, and publications. Experience working with executive leadership preferred


PERSONAL QUALITIES
  
  

* Creative, energized, proactive, and enthusiastic – willing to take initiative with confidence
* Outstanding attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
* Ability to easily transition from high-level strategic thinking to creative and detailed execution
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and autonomously
* Comfortable dealing with ambiguity
* Able to anticipate potential reputational issues
* A strong team player who thrives in a collaborative setting and works well within a global, matrixed environment
* Diplomatic, with the antennae to pick up on, and manage, organizational and cultural sensitivities
* Ability to remain calm and think clearly and quickly under pressure to make the right decisions--being courageous enough to push back on team members and even leaders if warranted


**Location and Travel:**  

This position can be based anywhere in the United States.
  
Fortive Corporation Overview
  
  

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.
  
  

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.
  
  

We are a diverse team 18,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.
  
  

**Fortive:** For you, for us, for growth.
  
  

Ready to move your career forward? Find out more at careers.fortive.com .
  
**A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation (NYSE:** FTV), Fluke Corporation is the world leader in the manufacture, distribution, and service of electronic test tools and software.
  
  

Fluke Reliability is an operating company of the Fluke Corporation that offers reliability and maintenance teams the tools, software, and services they need to optimize asset performance. Home to three powerful iconic brands – Fluke Connect, PRUFTECHNIK, and eMaint – Fluke Reliability serves more than 70,000 companies worldwide with a relentless dedication to quality, innovation, and service. Fluke Reliability informs customers on the health of their assets with software and services that drive better maintenance decisions – improving productivity, driving uptime, and reducing costs.
  
  

Fluke is a multi-national corporation headquartered in Everett, Washington, with the Fluke Reliability business division headquartered in Munich, Germany. "The company in which you have expressed employment interest is a subsidiary or affiliate of Fortive Corporation. The subsidiary or affiliate is referred to as a Fortive Company. Fortive Corporation and all Fortive Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), age, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, and other characteristics protected by law. The "EEO is the Law" poster is available at: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1-866-272-5573 or e-mail applyassistance@fortive.com to request accommodation."
  
  

**Everett, WA:** The salary range for this position is $99,015 - $183,885
  
  

This position is also eligible for bonus as part of the total compensation package.
  
  

Base pay offered may vary depending on various factors, including, but not limited to: job-related knowledge; skills; experience; and other eligibility factors such as geographic location. The Total Rewards package includes competitive base pay and an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and several programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
