title: Brand Manager
description:
**About NSTXL**  
The National Security Technology Accelerator (NSTXL) harvests innovative technology from the commercial and non-defense marketplace, ensuring the development of better, cheaper, and faster defense capabilities. We offer a unique and simplified approach to rapidly develop, demonstrate, and assess prototypes that address a range of operational and installation needs, from individual Warfighter technology up to large-scale installation projects. NSTXL delivers technology to the Warfighter by serving as a one-stop shop to match government requirements with innovative private-sector and academic solutions.

Each of our OTAs is a distinct member-based not-for-profit with its own membership that is managed and serviced by NSTXL. Currently, our OTAs have more than 900 corporate, non-profit, educational, and financial institution members. For these members, NSTXL offers opportunities to bid on government contracts, education and training, and live/virtual forums on a wide variety of topics.

\\*  
Job Description\\*  
The Brand Manager is responsible for the creating and managing NSTXL’s brand story and experience through compelling content and conversion-based strategy. You will play a pivotal role in developing and executing strategies to enhance the overall image and recognition of our primary and owned brands. This role will be responsible for ensuring that the brand remains cohesive, resonates with the target audience, and aligns with the company's objectives. This position requires a combination of creative thinking, strategic planning, and effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement comprehensive brand strategies to strengthen brand presence, conducting market research to understand consumer trends, competitor activities, and industry dynamics to inform brand strategy.
* Support Directors and Customers, collaborate with internal and external partners, to execute brand initiatives such as advertising agencies and vendors.
* Manage and mentor the Creative team.
* Track and evaluate brand performance metrics, providing regular reports and insights to the leadership team.
* Create and oversee the creation of content designed to raise target market awareness: videos, press, website, blogs, guides, customer stories, landing pages, market emails, social, etc.
* Develop comprehensive brand positioning strategies and toolkits for products and services, creating and optimizing new campaigns to support awareness of offerings and internal knowledge of services.
* Manage Editorial Calendar across all owned channels including blog, websites, social media, YouTube, and print media.
* Own website content, updates, and experience, implementing SEO best practices and identifying opportunities to increase new visitor traffic.
* Optimize NSTXL and other owned websites for conversions, creating new website pages and campaigns to support conversion goals.
* Ensure that anything leaving the marketing department, both self-generated and created by others, fully adheres to all brand standards.
* Work w/ Program and Event Teams for Creative strategy and execution for program collateral, PowerPoint, content development.

Manage assigned budget while making recommendations to best optimize spend to accomplish goal.  
\\*

**Location:**

Remote  
\\*  
Required Qualifications:\\*

* US citizen and ability to get security clearance.
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in brand, content, or digital marketing.
* 2+ years experience managing a team of 2 or more

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Ability to both create content and build a comprehensive content strategy.
* Excellent planning, organizational and problem-solving skills to successfully coordinate multiple programs and adapt to unexpected requests.
* Team player with a passion for creating moving, story-driven content that converts.
* Understanding of new media, traditional media, and emerging media with experience working across multiple mediums and channels.
* Enthusiasm for our mission and vision
* Knowledge of marketing automation, CRM and CMS, such as HubSpot or Sprout
* Understanding of social media platforms, from a creative and operational perspective
* Experience Adobe Design Suite and with Canva
* Deep understanding of SEO and how to optimize digital content.
* Project management experience and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Possess strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Must have excellent planning, organizational, and problem-solving skills.

**Travel:**

* Travel for this position is estimated at 20%

\\*  
What We Offer\\*  
The National Security Technology Accelerator (NSTXL) harvests innovative technology from the commercial and non-defense marketplace, ensuring the development of better, cheaper, and faster defense capabilities. We offer a unique and simplified approach to rapidly develop, demonstrate, and assess prototypes that address a range of operational and installation needs, from individual Warfighter technology up to large-scale installation projects. NSTXL delivers technology to the Warfighter by serving as a one-stop shop to match government requirements with innovative private-sector and academic solutions.  
We strive to be one of the best places to work in America. We offer competitive salaries and benefits, including flexible work hours, paid sick leave, work-from-home accommodations, a 401(k)-profit-sharing plan, a wellness plan, floating holidays, and much more.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Product Manager, Content Fulfillment
description:
Los Gatos, California
Product Management
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  

Content Promotion & Distribution (CPD) sits at the intersection of the consumer experience and the Netflix Studio. Our team is integral to making the Netflix experience feel personal and relevant by developing innovative approaches to how we catalog, promote, localize, and distribute content. Because our products touch both members and content creators, we seek someone who can fluidly move between both worlds, applying strong product principles and strategic frameworks to the member experience while deeply empathizing with the art and craft required to create great content.  

The Role
We are looking for a Product Manager to advance our portfolio of products that manage all the playable media assets consumed by over 260 million members worldwide. The Content Fulfillment PM is responsible for the systems and services that enable our business users around the world to order, route, prepare, deliver, validate, process, and track over 3M VOD assets annually; the critical content systems needed to ensure the accurate and timely fulfillment and evaluation of each and every playable media asset. You’ll develop innovative solutions to further scale how media assets are delivered, managed, and assembled for playback, including live streaming technology to support a growing programming slate of live events. You’ll optimize our quality control systems and workflows while innovating on how we protect the Netflix experience. You’ll partner closely with product managers across Globalization, Promotional Media, Marketing Technology, and adjacent Studio product areas.  

This will be a remote-friendly role, with the freedom to set a flexible work-from-home schedule. This role would be best for candidates located in the Pacific time zone, as bi-monthly in-person travel may be necessary to collaborate with stakeholders and partners in Los Angeles, CA, and Los Gatos, CA. That said, we can always make exceptions in location for the right candidate.  

About Our Team
We innovate on a portfolio of products, services, and data models responsible for the setup, preparation, fulfillment, and distribution of titles. Our goal is to make launching titles on Netflix as easy as pressing a button on your remote. We work with diverse and globally distributed groups of business users and vendors. We also build the foundational capabilities and technology for the next generation of Netflix experiences, like games, ads, and live.  

Our team’s primary superpower is the ability to work creatively and collaboratively in highly technical environments – from core services that power Netflix search and discovery to industry-leading content management platforms.**What You Will Do**
--------------------

* Devise and communicate a vision and strategy for the domain broadly throughout the organization.
* Own the content fulfillment and QC portfolio of products that manage media assets and orchestrate workflows from creation to playback.
* Develop and deliver a roadmap that balances the needs of our partner teams and prioritizes what is most impactful for our members and the business.
* Lead cross-functional teams, including design, engineering, and data science, to discover and execute opportunities through automation, including transforming workflows using ML and AI.
* Partner with different teams responsible for launching titles and new and emerging experiences, including Product Discovery & Promotions, Encoding Technologies, and Studio teams.
* Author strategy memos and presentations and represent your team’s work to senior executives.
* Operate with true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate
**What We’re Looking For**
--------------------------

* 6+ years of experience as a Product Manager within the media, content, and/or live streaming systems with a proven record of successfully prioritizing, ideating, and launching impactful products and solutions.
* Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead a cross-functional team - your ability to build strong relationships is critical to success.
* Exceptional analytical skills and ability to balance short-term goals and long-term vision.
* Deep experience using data and metrics to influence business decisions, inform priorities, and evaluate impact of initiatives.
* Demonstrated experience working effectively across different technical teams and with data scientists, machine learning engineers, statisticians, etc.
* Excellent communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations whether in written documents, small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or to executives.
* An ideal candidate is a highly motivated, self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity.

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: SaaS Content Writer (FULLY REMOTE)
description:
**Does your B2B content prove to convert?**
-------------------------------------------


At WhatConverts we innovate and initiate. We're a dynamic SaaS company who offers a comprehensive lead tracking solution for marketers - one place to track ALL leads.


As a Content Writer at WhatConverts, you'll write and promote traffic-driving content that provides insight into our product, brand and industry - all with the goal of achieving conversions.***Please note that previous proven experience writing B2B and/or SaaS marketing content is required for consideration.***


This is a fully-remote, full-time position (40 hours per week). We are also open to considering candidates on a freelance/contract basis. This candidate will ideally be located in the U.S. or within 3 hours +/- EST time zone.


**In this role you'll get to:**


* Work collaboratively with the marketing team, content writers, designers, and other stakeholders to identify content requirements, brainstorm ideas, and create content that aligns with the content marketing strategy while solving our audience's problems
* Write and edit a range of content types including blogs, FAQ material, support documentation, landing pages, websites, mobile apps, and other digital media
* Conduct in-depth research, subject matter expert interviews, and product testing to identify nuanced audience pain points and understand the solutions our product offers
* Collaborate with the marketing and communications teams to ensure a consistent brand voice and tone across all customer touchpoints
* Continuously follow proven content writing best practices while monitoring for emerging content trends


**What we're looking for:**


* 4+ years of experience as a content writer, copywriter, or related role **writing B2B and/or SaaS marketing content.** ***This is required!***
* Proven ability to write clear, concise, and engaging content for digital products and interfaces
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* Must be curious, with the ability to handle direct feedback
* Experience with in-depth research, fact-checking, and revising
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* Passion for creating exceptional content that is above all helpful to our audience


**Company Benefits/Perks:**


* **Remote first company** - we believe in breaking down barriers of bureaucracy and empowering our remote team members to work agilely to accomplish more in a shorter amount of time.
* **Immediate impact** - the moment you join our team we hand you the reins to work on projects independently and make a direct impact.
* **Health/Wellness** - we offer a variety of premium medical insurance plans, as well as dental and vision insurance - making sure you have access to the coverage that works best for you. WhatConverts covers 100% of the premium cost for individual employee coverage under selected base plans, as well as the full cost of employee Life/LTD/STD insurance coverage.
* **Employee support** - we provide an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) that offers counseling, legal, debt management, and travel assistance services free of cost to our employees.
* **Time off** - in addition to paid holidays, WhatConverts offers both flexible time off and competitive PTO plans that continue to offer greater rewards to long-term employees.
* **Diversity and inclusion** - our workplace is positive, supportive, and inclusive and we ask all new hires to bring that same approach.


**Before you apply, you should:**


* Learn about (http://www.whatconverts.com/) our team
* Read about what makes us different (https://www.whatconverts.com/careers) or watch a product overview (https://www.whatconverts.com/watch-a-demo)
* Read our reviews on G2 (https://www.g2.com/products/whatconverts/reviews)

  

  

*WhatConverts is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, hire, pay, and promote without regard to gender, race, sexual orientation, age, religion, veteran status, physical/mental abilities, or any other identities protected by law.*

title: Content Manager
description:
Maxio was born in April 2021 when Battery Ventures invested +$150M to bring together two companies that were each amazing in their own right: SaaSOptics, which streamlined financial operations and analytics for SaaS businesses, and Chargify, the leader in billing and subscription management for B2B SaaS.


Both Chargify and SaaSOptics did amazing work creating must-have tools for CFOs and product leaders. By bringing them together, Maxio has created an opportunity to build tech that’s essential not just for CFOs, but also for CEOs, investors, and every other SaaS business operator: a true “SaaS-in-a-box platform” that will unleash growth for subscription businesses all the way from startup through IPO.


Maxio is more than the sum of its parts. With smart operations and world-class investors behind us, Maxio is in a position to change the way that subscription businesses operate—and help transform new businesses to operate more efficiently, scale faster, and reach more customers.

  

We are seeking a skilled **Content Manager** tasked with developing Maxio’s presence as a thought leader and producing high-quality content across a variety of Marketing channels, focused on supporting both brand awareness and demand generation.

 **WHAT:**

* Developing and executing a content marketing strategy in line with the overall Maxio marketing team themes and operating plan
* Managing content calendar and channels, including blogs, downloadables, webinars, and newsletters
* Collaborating with internal teams and subject matter experts to gather insights and create accurate and effective content
* Keeping up with industry trends and topics to inform Maxio’s messaging and thought leadership
* Serving as an exemplary writer, consistent with our company’s tone and mission with clean, concise, well-polished copy
* Directing the production of informative and engaging content
* Editing and approving a wide variety of marketing content to maintain Maxio’s quality standards
* Implementing SEO best practices to enhance content visibility and search engine rankings.
* Working with agencies and freelancers where applicable
* Providing accurate and timely project reporting on content performance (including traffic, conversion, engagement, etc.)

**WHO:**

* Strong writing and editing skill
* Strong project management and organizational skills
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* 5+ years experience producing various types of marketing content, including blogs, ebooks, emails, and other resources
* Experience managing an SEO keyword strategy to increase traffic growth, and a willingness to self-educate on the latest AI search requirments

 **Maxio Benefits & Perks:**

  

* Health, dental, and vision insurance plans
* Medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts
* Paid monthly mental healthcare access with Headspace
* Open PTO - we like to keep this simple...making time for life is important!
* 13 paid standard holidays each year - Including a company-wide Winter Break
* 401(k) savings plan with company match!
* Macbook Laptop
* Paid Parental Leave
* A collaborative, entrepreneurial learning environment with a proven playbook
* Remote/Onsite/Hybrid working options

 *Maxio is committed to providing all team members a truly unique experience with opportunities for professional development and involvement in multiple dimensions of running and growing our business.*

***Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:*** *we are committed to an environment that promotes equality, diversity, and inclusion. It's important to us that you bring your true self to work every day, no matter your age, ethnicity, religion, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, neurodiversity, or otherwise.*

title: Retention Marketing Manager
Digital Content, Email Marketing & Social Media Manager
description:
**About us**

We believe that actors don’t have to be struggling artists. Every actor has a gift that the world needs. We’ve helped thousands of actors around the world become successful and the formula is as simple as ABC: -game mentality, usiness know-how, raft.There are countless coaches who teach craft, and plenty of personal development gurus out there, but not a lot of business experts with first-hand knowledge and a proven track record.

Career ACTivate is the leading organization giving actors the business know-how to get more auditions, book better work, and find great representation. If there’s something that you want that you don’t have, it just means that there’s something you don’t know yet. That’s where we come in to support actors in having the career and life they want.

We are seeking a dynamic and creative Content, Email Marketing and Social Media Manager to join our team! In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing our content strategy across Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, and email newsletters. Your goal will be to enhance our brand presence, engage our audience, drive traffic to our website, and get actors interested in our courses and Program.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Content Strategy Development**: Create and implement a comprehensive content strategy that aligns with Career ACTivate’s goals and our audience’s interests.
* **Content Creation and Management**: Produce high-quality content for our social media platforms and weekly email newsletter. This includes creating graphics & reels, editing & producing 5-8 minute long-form videos, and writing a weekly newsletter.
* **Social Media Management**: Manage our social media profiles, including content planning, posting, engagement, and analytics. Stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends and best practices.
* **Email Newsletter Management**: Design and execute email marketing campaigns, aligning with the marketing campaigns developed by the team. This includes newsletters, promotional emails, and targeted socials campaigns.
* **Brand Voice and Messaging**: Ensure a consistent brand voice and messaging across all content and platforms.
* **Analytics and Reporting**: Track and analyze performance metrics to gauge content effectiveness and adjust strategies as needed.
* **Audience Engagement**: Foster community engagement, respond to comments and inquiries, and build relationships with followers.
* **Collaboration**: Work closely with other team members and Career ACTivate Coaches to ensure a cohesive brand strategy and to gather insights for content creation.

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience in content creation, social media management, and email marketing.
* Strong writing and copy-editing skills, with attention to detail.
* Proficiency in social media platforms: Instagram, TikTok and Facebook.
* Basic design skills and familiarity with design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva).
* Basic video editing skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to analyze data and derive actionable insights.
* Creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative ideas.
* Strong organizational and time-management skills.

**Time Commitment**

Approximately 8-15 hours/week

**What We Offer**

* A friendly work-from-home environment
* Flexible hours - we’re actors too so we know what it’s like to have stuff come up last-minute!
* Opportunities for professional growth and development
* Business-of-acting information that you can use in your own career
* This is a part-time, remote position

**To Apply**

Email support@careeractivate.com with the subject line DCSMO/[First Name Last Name]/ [Desired Hourly Rate] and answers to the following:

* What are the 3 strongest skills that make you a good fit?Bullet point your experience (if any) in the entertainment industry. It’s okay if you haven’t had any entertainment experience.
* What are the first 3 immediate improvements you would implement on our IG account?
* Share a sample of copy you’ve written that you’re proud of. This could be a social media caption or an email.
* Attach a PDF version of your resume.

**Deadline to Submit**

ASAP (we are looking to hire someone who is a great fit as soon as possible)

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $5.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 – 15 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Experience:

* Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Associate Marketing Manager
description:
Great Minds, a rapidly growing, mission driven Public Benefits Corporation (PBC) that develops high quality knowledge building curricula for grades PK-12, seeks an Associate Marketing Manager to join our growing team.

  

**Company Profile**



Great Minds brings teachers and scholars together to craft exemplary instructional materials that inspire joy in teaching and learning. Our curricula, *Wit & Wisdom*®; Geodes; Eureka Math™; and PhD Science™ all support teachers as they take students beyond rote learning to provide a deeper, more complete understanding of the humanities, mathematics, and sciences. Founded in 2007, Great Minds now employs more than 1,100 people.  

  

For additional information please visit: www.greatminds.org

  

**Our Market Position**



Great Minds’ Eureka Math™ is the most widely used curriculum in the history of American education. It enjoys an unrivaled 40+ net promoter score. Eureka Math™ and its sister products, *Wit & Wisdom*® and PhD Science™, embrace much higher expectations for all students and all teachers. In a market dominated by scripted, procedural materials that drive expectations down, Great Minds produces curricula that celebrate knowledge, respect the craft of teaching, and acknowledge the true capabilities of students.

 **Job Purpose**

  


The Associate Marketing Manager provides marketing execution and operational support to support the business goals of our instructional materials and services. This position will report to the Manager, Product Marketing and work closely with the entire Great Minds marketing team.

  

  

  

**Specific Responsibilities:**


* Writing, editing, and deploying marketing campaigns using HubSpot’s marketing automation tools
* Writing copy and creating landing pages using HubSpot
* Tracking and analyzing campaign results to measure effectiveness
* Organizing, promoting, and serving as producer for webinars with content experts using GoTo Webinar and Zoom Webinar
* Crafting and presenting sales, marketing, and/or research reports on an ongoing basis
* Supporting website content management
* Maintaining the internal library of marketing documents and materials
* Providing administrative support to the marketing team
* Writing and posting relevant, high-quality content blogs while tracking effectiveness

  

  

  

**Required Qualifications:**


* Minimum of one year using enterprise level marketing automation platform (e.g., HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot, or a similar platform)
* Experience building web pages, preferably using HubSpot
* 1–2 years of professional marketing experience
* BA in Marketing, Communications, or relevant field
* Interest in PK–12 education and/or education publishing is preferred
* Strong writing and editing skills are essential
* Fastidious attention to detail
* Strong team player, able to harmoniously work within a group and/or other departments
* Self-starter able to prioritize and balance multiple projects
* Command of MS Office applications (Word, PowerPoint and Excel)
* Experience with any of the following is a plus, Photoshop, InDesign, Canva, MailChimp, Google Analytics, Google AdWords, and/or Salesforce


**Details:**

  

**Required Education:**


* Bachelor's degree


**Status:**


* Full-time


**Location:**


* Remote



New employees will be required to successfully complete a background check.

  

The base salary range for this position is $54,000.00-$62,500.00, however the offered salary may be higher or lower than the above range dependent on numerous factors including, but not limited to location, work experience, skills and internal equity considerations.. The base salary is not inclusive of benefits or other incentives.

  

Any communication to applicants relating to the Great Minds hiring process will only come from email addresses with the domains **greatminds.org**or **greatminds.recruitee.com**. If in the course of the application or hiring process with Great Minds you are contacted through another domain, are requested to provide banking or other sensitive information, or you note any other suspicious activity, please contact security@greatminds.org

  

Great Minds is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, disability, age, genetic information, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. Our policy reflects and affirms the organization’s commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices.

title: US Social Media Manager (Permanent Work from Home)
description:
**Job Description:**

A Social Media Manager oversees a company’s interactions with the public by implementing social media platforms’ content strategies. Duties include analyzing engagement data, identifying trends in customer interactions, and planning digital campaigns to build community online.

**Duties & Responsibilities:** 

* Performs research on current benchmark trends and audience preferences.
* Designs and implements social media strategy to align with business goals.
* Sets specific objectives and report on ROI.
* Generates, edits, publishes, and shares engaging content daily (e.g. original text, photos, videos, and news).
* Monitors SEO and web traffic metrics.
* Collaborates with other teams to ensure brand consistency.
* Communicates with followers, responds to queries promptly, and monitors customer reviews.
* Oversees social media account design (e.g. Facebook timeline cover, profile pictures, and blog layout).
* Suggests and implements new features to develop brand awareness, like promotions and competitions.
* Stay up-to-date with current technologies and trends in social media, design tools, applications, and best practices.

* Passionate about content creation and knowledgeable about the latest changes in social apps i.e. Tiktok/Instagram/Pinterest and other social media platforms
* Has hands-on experience in content management with a solid portfolio demonstrating excellence in content creation, copywriting, performance measurement, research, and calendar planning.
* Demonstrated ability to confidently, easily, and clearly communicate creative solutions to internal teams and clients.
* Knowledge of multiple social media platforms and a team leader are required.
* Proficiency in all things Google; especially Google Sheets.
* You must be a US Citizen
* Must have the following: a) Own computer unit; b) Stable lined/wired internet connection and backup; c) and backup power supply.

title: Content Specialist
description:
**About the Company**



POS Nation is a small company in a fast-growing, high-tech industry — and this is evident in everything we do. Being part of a small company means that everything you do makes a significant impact on the business. This kind of responsibility is not for everyone, but it's hugely rewarding and fulfilling if you are successful.


* Want to know more about POS Nation? https://www.posnation.com/about-us
* What's it like working at POS Nation? See here: https://youtu.be/8b9ikkkyElI
* We recently won the Great Place to Work Certification to learn more follow this link: https://www.greatplacetowork.com/certified-company/7046336


**About the Role**



Join our tight-knit marketing team where our mantra is collaboration and execution against goals! Even in a creative role, we take a data-driven approach to all of our marketing initiatives. We're looking for a creative specialist to join our team and merge their written and design expertise with our brand guidelines to provide content that will delight our prospects and customers!


**What you will do**


* Writing compelling copy across all marketing channels, including website copy, email campaigns, blog posts, video scripts, digital and print ads, and packaging
* Editing and proofreading copy before it goes live
* Adhering and maintaining the brand voice and tone
* Using data-driven marketing to guide all copy decisions
* Thriving in a fast-paced work environment and meeting tight deadlines
* Working on multiple projects at once and excelling at project management
* Collaborating with colleagues from other departments to help them hit their marketing goals
* Knowing how to use popular digital marketing tools, including Adobe Creative Suite, content management software, search engine optimization software, and website analytics software


**Requirements**



This position plays a vital role in our success. Here are some highlights of the type of person and background we believe would thrive:


* Comfortable receiving and adapting to feedback
* Strong attention to detail. If there's an undotted 'i' you'll find it
* Develops strong working relationships
* Communicates effectively and has strong written and verbal presentation skills
* Learns quickly and enjoys tackling new projects
* Works well independently and with a team
* Knows how to write in a brand's voice and tone
* Uses qualitative and quantitative analysis to guide content decisions
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, journalism, English, or a related major is required
* At least two years of agency or in-house copywriting experience is strongly preferred
* Marketing automation software experience preferred. HubSpot is a plus
* Written and designed samples are required with your application


**POS Nation Employee Perks**


* Monthly company events
* Company-sponsored health insurance
* 401k investment opportunity with company match
* Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay
* Dog-friendly work environment


**Salary Range:** $55-65k  

**Location:** Remote based in United States

title: Content Creator
description:
**Job Category:** Non-technical
**Job Type:** Freelance
**Job Location:** Remote
#### **About Kyla**


Kyla helps you live longer. First, Kyla collects your medical history, blood sample, and DNA. Then, Kyla AI analyzes your medical data to identify your top health risks, estimate your remaining lifetime, and give you simple, doctor-validated daily goals to increase your life expectancy. Finally, Kyla monitors your progress 24×7, diagnoses, and treats your conditions with the help of doctors.


Join our Kyla.com team of medical providers, product leaders, engineers, and AI scientists to grant people the power to understand their health from a new perspective in order to improve their life expectancy. Our ActionUrgentCare.com medical infrastructure consists of 14 Medical Clinics and a High Complexity Laboratory in California, USA, and has been in business for 10+ years. We’re working with Fortune 500 companies, schools, and individuals by the thousands and are rapidly growing.


#### **About the role**


We are seeking a dynamic and highly organized Content Creator for a part-time role. As a Content Creator, you will play a crucial role in producing evergreen content that remains relevant and valuable over a more extended period. The ideal candidate possesses a strong editorial mindset, excellent communication skills, and a proven track record of creating engaging and relevant content. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the alignment of content with business goals and brand voice.


#### **What you need to succeed:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or a related field.
* Proven experience in working as a Content Creator or similar role.
* Exceptional writing and editing skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Familiarity with SEO best practices and content marketing strategies.
* Strong project management skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines.
* Creative thinker with the ability to generate innovative ideas and solutions.

#### **What you will do:**


* Create, edit, and publish high-quality, compelling content for various platforms, including websites, blogs, social media, and email newsletters.
* Collaborate with subject matter experts and other teams to gather information and insights for content creation.
* Edit and proofread content to maintain accuracy and clarity.
* Optimize content for search engines, incorporating relevant keywords and best practices.
* Stay updated on SEO trends and implement strategies to improve organic search performance.
* Collaborate with marketing, design, and other teams to align content with overall marketing initiatives.

2. The date when you can start


3. Salary expectation per hour
